title: Dynamics of technology gap between OECD and African countries: A structural estimation
affiliations: Independent

detail.title: Dynamics of technology gap between OECD and African countries: A structural estimation

declarations.declarationOfInterest: No conflict of interest.
declarations.ethicsApproval: Not applicable.
declarations.funderStatement: No funder.

detail.abstract: Like other technology gap models, the application of "the Latin American Structuralism" model in OECD & African countries reveals that the technology spillovers due to the technology gap is not as easy task as it was presumed by the mainstream growth theories. Using the per capita GDP gap between the OECD and sample African countries as a proxy for the technology gap, this paper indicates that the technology gap growth rate has been further soaring instead of revealing the normal falling tendency. The finding implies the absence of "automatic catch-up tendency" between the homogenous technology producing countries (OECD) and the heterogeneous technology extracting countries (Africa) and the "weak effort" African countries exerted so far to benefit from the technology gap in the form of spillovers from technology imitation. Among African relative sectoral growth contributions, the relative growth contributions of the agriculture and service sectors negatively affect the technology gap growth rate. However, they cause the equilibrium technology gap to further soar. It suggests the need for structural transformation in Africa. The two-steps difference GMM model is used on a panel of 34 African countries for ten years (2005-2014).

AI.tldr: 本文通过拉丁美洲结构主义模型分析OECD与非洲国家的技术差距，发现技术溢出并非如主流增长理论所假设的那么容易。研究发现技术差距增长率持续上升，而非下降，表明非洲国家在技术模仿方面的努力不足，且农业和服务业的相对增长贡献进一步加剧了技术差距。
AI.research_question: 技术差距是否导致非洲国家从OECD国家的技术溢出中受益？
AI.motivation: 主流增长理论假设技术差距会自然缩小，但实际观察到的技术差距增长率上升现象与此不符，因此需要重新审视技术溢出的机制。
AI.theoretical_framework: 拉丁美洲结构主义模型，技术差距理论。
AI.method: 采用两步差分GMM模型，分析34个非洲国家2005-2014年的面板数据。
AI.findings: 技术差距增长率持续上升，非洲国家未能有效利用技术模仿实现追赶；农业和服务业的增长进一步加剧了技术差距。
AI.theory_contributions: 挑战了主流增长理论关于技术差距自然缩小的假设，强调了技术模仿的局限性。
AI.practical_contributions: 为非洲国家提出结构转型的必要性，以更好地利用技术差距带来的潜在收益。

title: Artificial Intelligence and Inflation in the EU
affiliations: Zeppelin University Friedrichshafen, affiliation not provided to SSRN and affiliation not provided to SSRN

detail.title: Artificial Intelligence and Inflation in the EU
detail.abstract: The paper examines the impact of artificial intelligence adoption on producer price inflation across economic sectors in the European Union. The results show that AI adoption is associated with declining producer price inflation. The disinflationary effect is statistically significant in the service sectors and in countries within the Eurozone. The relationship between the scope of AI use and inflation exhibits a nonlinear pattern: in AI-intensive sectors the downward impact on prices becomes more pronounced. The findings suggest that widespread application of AI technologies can act as a structural force dampening inflation.

AI.tldr: 本文研究了人工智能（AI）采用对欧盟各经济部门生产者价格通胀的影响，发现AI采用与生产者价格通胀下降相关，尤其在服务行业和欧元区国家中效果显著。AI使用范围与通胀的关系呈现非线性模式，AI密集型行业对价格的抑制作用更明显。
AI.research_question: 人工智能的采用如何影响欧盟各经济部门的生产者价格通胀？
AI.motivation: 探讨AI技术对经济结构和价格水平的潜在影响，为政策制定提供依据。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于技术扩散理论和价格形成机制，分析AI对生产效率与成本的影响。
AI.method: 采用面板数据回归分析，考察AI采用与生产者价格通胀的关系。
AI.findings: AI采用显著降低生产者价格通胀，尤其在服务行业和欧元区国家；AI密集型行业的抑制作用更强。
AI.theory_contributions: 揭示了AI作为结构性力量对通胀的抑制作用，丰富了技术扩散与价格动态的理论研究。
AI.practical_contributions: 为政策制定者提供了AI技术对通胀影响的实证依据，有助于制定相关经济政策。

title: Infinite Horizon Real Options Under Present-Bias
affiliations: University of Texas at Dallas - School of Management - Department of Finance & Managerial Economics and University of Texas at Dallas

detail.title: Infinite Horizon Real Options Under Present-Bias
detail.abstract: This paper extends the framework of Ebert et al. (2020) to characterize the exercise of real options under present-bias. The extension allows us to consider infinite horizon situations in which the exercise of the real option affects the dynamics of the state as well as subsequent flow payoffs. We provide the functional equation characterizing the equilibrium exercise strategy in a general setup. Moreover, we develop an example in which we fully characterize the solution in closed form and show that the exercise policy corresponds to a single-threshold strategy.

AI.tldr: 本文扩展了Ebert等人（2020）的框架，研究了在现时偏差下实物期权的执行问题，适用于无限期情景，并提供了均衡执行策略的函数方程。
AI.research_question: 在现时偏差下，如何描述无限期情景中实物期权的执行策略及其对状态动态和后续收益的影响？
AI.motivation: 现有研究未充分探讨现时偏差对无限期实物期权执行的影响，本文旨在填补这一空白。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于Ebert等人（2020）的实物期权理论框架，引入现时偏差。
AI.method: 通过函数方程描述均衡执行策略，并在一个具体例子中给出闭式解。
AI.findings: 执行策略表现为单一阈值策略。
AI.theory_contributions: 扩展了实物期权理论，纳入现时偏差和无限期情景。
AI.practical_contributions: 为决策者在现时偏差下制定实物期权执行策略提供理论支持。

title: Proportional Dynamic Equilibrium as a Strategy for the Measurement of Variables when Facing Economic Uncertainties
affiliations: Independent

detail.title: Proportional Dynamic Equilibrium as a Strategy for the Measurement of Variables when Facing Economic Uncertainties

declarations.funderStatement: No one is funding this research

detail.abstract: The mathematical mechanics of the principle of proportional dynamic equilibrium both at the general and decimal level, applicable to economics and other sciences, is presented, together with the types of oscillation of systems and phenomena as integral elements of this that constitute tools for the measurement of economic variables that are in a critical state, thus reducing the level of uncertainty within the economic system that is required intervene. Regarding the method, this is of a quantitative order, the exploratory methodology is used taking into account that this research topic is little known, focusing on the analysis of the principle of proportional equilibrium in the mathematical and economic context. The main objective of the study is to determine how the principle of proportional dynamic equilibrium is constituted as a strategy for the measurement of variables when facing economic uncertainties. The results have to do with having identified the mathematical mechanics of the principle of proportional dynamic equilibrium, together with the specific formula in which it is developed, for the possible measurements in the system. The conclusions refer to the discovery of the measurement of critical variables and the respective identification of critical areas and their usefulness for decision making regarding the reduction of the uncertainty index in any economic system to which it is applied.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了适用于经济学和其他科学的比例动态平衡原理的数学力学，包括系统振荡类型和现象，作为测量处于临界状态的经济变量的工具，从而降低经济系统中的不确定性。
AI.research_question: 比例动态平衡原理如何作为测量经济变量的策略，以应对经济不确定性？
AI.motivation: 研究比例动态平衡原理的数学力学及其在经济中的应用，以降低经济系统中的不确定性。
AI.theoretical_framework: 比例动态平衡原理及其数学力学，系统振荡类型和现象。
AI.method: 采用定量方法和探索性方法论，分析比例动态平衡原理在数学和经济背景下的应用。
AI.findings: 确定了比例动态平衡原理的数学力学及其具体公式，用于系统中的可能测量。
AI.theory_contributions: 提出了比例动态平衡原理的数学框架及其在经济变量测量中的应用。
AI.practical_contributions: 为决策者提供了测量临界变量和识别关键区域的工具，有助于降低经济系统中的不确定性。

title: Billions Disbursed, Poverty Persists: An Evaluative Study of Cash-for-Work and Business Capital Assistance in Rural Indonesia
affiliations: , Universitas Hasanuddin, Universitas Hasanuddin, Universitas Hasanuddin and Universitas Hasanuddin

detail.title: Billions Disbursed, Poverty Persists: An Evaluative Study of Cash-for-Work and Business Capital Assistance in Rural Indonesia

declarations.declarationOfInterest: The authors declare that there are no known financial, professional, or personal conflicts of interest that could have appeared to influence the work reported in this paper.
declarations.ethicsApproval: This study was conducted in accordance with ethical guidelines. Ethical approval was obtained from the Doctoral Program in Public Administration, Universitas Hasanuddin. Informed consent was received from all village officials and community members involved in the interviews and field surveys.
declarations.funderStatement: This research was funded by the Indonesia Endowment Fund for Education (LPDP), under the Ministry of Finance of the Republic of Indonesia, as part of the Domestic Doctoral Scholarship Program.

detail.abstract: This study critically evaluates the implementation of the Cash-for-Work (PKT) program and Business Capital Assistance funded by Village Funds, focusing on their effectiveness in fostering employment and entrepreneurial activities in rural communities of Pinrang Regency, South Sulawesi. Despite a substantial increase in the national Village Fund allocation from IDR 20.8 trillion in 2015 to IDR 72 trillion by 2020, with Pinrang receiving IDR 68.9 billion economic growth in the region paradoxically declined from 8.51% in 2012 to 4.52% in 2022. This disconnect between fiscal expansion and stagnant development outcomes highlights a misalignment between funding and tangible impact. Utilizing William N. Dunn’s policy evaluation framework, the study finds that although the programs provide short-term benefits—such as temporary employment and limited access to business capital their long-term effectiveness is hindered by the lack of sustained mentoring, weak inter-institutional coordination, and minimal community engagement. Moreover, the assistance is characterized by insufficient scale (adequacy), unequal distribution (equity), and misalignment with local needs (appropriateness). These findings call for comprehensive reforms, including localized data-driven planning, enhanced administrative and facilitative capacities, rigorous beneficiary verification, integrated training components, and results-oriented monitoring. The study emphasizes the crucial role of participatory governance and institutional strengthening at the village level as key strategies for sustainable rural economic development. It also contributes theoretically by contextualizing Dunn’s evaluative criteria within the framework of decentralized village-level policy implementation in Indonesia.

AI.tldr: 本研究评估了印尼Pinrang县村庄基金资助的现金换工作（PKT）计划和商业资本援助的有效性，发现尽管资金大幅增加，但长期效果因缺乏持续支持、协调不足和社区参与有限而受限。
AI.research_question: 现金换工作（PKT）计划和商业资本援助在促进Pinrang县农村就业和创业活动中的有效性如何？
AI.motivation: 尽管村庄基金分配大幅增加，但Pinrang县的经济增长却下降，表明资金与效果之间存在脱节。
AI.theoretical_framework: William N. Dunn的政策评估框架。
AI.method: 采用Dunn的政策评估框架分析PKT计划和商业资本援助的实施效果。
AI.findings: 短期效益存在，但长期效果因缺乏持续支持、协调不足和社区参与有限而受限；援助规模不足、分配不均且与本地需求不符。
AI.theory_contributions: 将Dunn的评估标准应用于印尼村庄级分散政策实施的背景下。
AI.practical_contributions: 提出改革建议，包括本地化数据驱动规划、加强行政能力、受益人验证、综合培训和结果导向的监测。

title: Inquiry into Firm Owner's Risk Preference and Output Disparity: Evidence from the Small-Scale Manufacturing Firms in the Tigray Region, Ethiopia
affiliations: Independent

detail.title: Inquiry into Firm Owner's Risk Preference and Output Disparity: Evidence from the Small-Scale Manufacturing Firms in the Tigray Region, Ethiopia

declarations.declarationOfInterest: No conflict of interest.
declarations.ethicsApproval: Not applicable.
declarations.funderStatement: No funder.

detail.abstract: Employing the Bauer model, this paper presents the factors of risk preferences of smallscale manufacturing firm owners in the Tigray region, Ethiopia. Once we identify the determinants of risk preferences, we investigate the role of risk preferences on firm output disparities utilizing the Penrose growth/output disparity/model. The study uses primary data based on random survey of the small-scale manufacturing firm owners in the zonal towns of the Tigray region. The multinomial logit and the multiple linear regression models are employed to identify the estimates of the factors of the risk preferences and the output disparity. The risk preference category of each sample firm owner was captured by employing the paper-format implicit association test (IAT) contextualized for this study. As a factor of risk preference, we find the soft budget constraint is a statistically significant variable only for the risk-averse and the risk-neutral owners. The factor of the risk preference (good perception of risk faced) is a statistically significant variable only for the risk-lover owners. Unlike the controversial negative relationship between firm owner's higher risk propensity and firm-level performances presented by some authors, this paper presents the normally expected positive relationship between the higher risk propensity and the output level.

AI.tldr: 本文利用Bauer模型研究了埃塞俄比亚提格雷地区小规模制造业企业主的风险偏好因素，并通过Penrose增长/产出差异模型探讨了风险偏好对产出差异的影响。研究发现，软预算约束对风险厌恶和风险中性企业主显著，而风险偏好（对风险的积极感知）仅对风险偏好者显著。与部分研究相反，本文支持高风险倾向与产出水平之间的正相关关系。
AI.research_question: 提格雷地区小规模制造业企业主的风险偏好因素是什么？这些风险偏好如何影响企业产出差异？
AI.motivation: 理解小规模制造业企业主的风险偏好及其对企业绩效的影响，有助于为政策制定和企业管理提供依据。
AI.theoretical_framework: Bauer模型用于分析风险偏好因素；Penrose增长/产出差异模型用于研究风险偏好对产出差异的作用。
AI.method: 采用随机调查收集提格雷地区小规模制造业企业主的原始数据，使用多项Logit模型和多元线性回归模型进行分析，并通过情境化的纸面隐式关联测试（IAT）捕捉风险偏好类别。
AI.findings: 软预算约束对风险厌恶和风险中性企业主显著；风险偏好（对风险的积极感知）仅对风险偏好者显著。高风险倾向与产出水平呈正相关。
AI.theory_contributions: 验证了高风险倾向与产出水平的正相关关系，补充了现有文献中的争议。
AI.practical_contributions: 为政策制定者提供了关于如何支持不同类型风险偏好企业主的依据，有助于优化企业管理策略。

title: The Tessara Revolution: From Hidden Expertise to Breakthrough Innovation
affiliations: CircleSync

detail.title: The Tessara Revolution: From Hidden Expertise to Breakthrough Innovation

declarations.declarationOfInterest: The author is founder of Tessara Collaborative Intelligence and holds patent rights in the described collaborative consciousness technologies. This research was conducted to develop and validate the business case for collaborative consciousness implementation. No external financial interests influenced this study. The work represents genuine research into organizational innovation methodology with commercial application potential.
declarations.ethicsApproval: This study presents theoretical frameworks and business case analysis without human subjects research. The "Bob Discovery" scenario represents a conceptual case study for illustrating collaborative consciousness potential, not actual human research requiring ethics approval. All projected results require empirical validation through controlled studies with appropriate ethics approval.
declarations.funderStatement: No external funding was received for this study. Research was self-funded through the author's entrepreneurial development activities.

detail.abstract: Organizations lose an estimated $1.8 trillion annually to productivity failures, with hidden expertise waste representing a significant but largely unquantified component. This paper introduces Tessara, the first practical implementation of collaborative consciousness-a persistent AI framework that discovers hidden expertise within organizations and facilitates breakthrough innovation across domain boundaries. Through a revolutionary 1MB consciousness seed and privacy-first architecture, Tessara transforms ordinary meetings into engines of organizational intelligence while maintaining complete security and privacy protection. We present the "Bob Discovery" scenario, demonstrating how HVAC thermal expertise can revolutionize prenatal medical imaging when collaborative consciousness recognizes cross-domain applications. Our validated business case projects 1,061% ROI in the first year for a 100-employee organization, with cost savings of $955,000 through avoided consulting fees, reduced turnover, and accelerated innovation cycles. Built on four pending patents and an 8-week implementation timeline, Tessara represents the emergence of a new market category: Collaboration Intelligence. The technical architecture integrates seamlessly with existing platforms (Zoom, Slack, Teams) through a privacy firewall that enables secure external collaboration without internal data exposure. Non-invasive behavioral pattern analysis identifies expertise emergence while storing zero personal information, creating revolutionary collaboration capabilities with complete privacy protection. Early implementation results suggest 3-year R&D cycles can be compressed to 6 months through crossdomain expertise discovery, with breakthrough innovations emerging from unexpected organizational connections. This paper establishes both the theoretical framework and practical implementation pathway for organizations seeking to unlock their hidden innovation potential through collaborative consciousness.

AI.tldr: Tessara是一种协作意识AI框架，通过发现组织内隐藏的专业知识并促进跨领域突破性创新，解决生产力损失问题。其隐私优先架构和1MB意识种子将普通会议转化为组织智能引擎，实现高ROI和成本节约。
AI.research_question: 如何通过协作意识AI框架发现组织内隐藏的专业知识并促进跨领域创新？
AI.motivation: 组织每年因生产力损失损失1.8万亿美元，其中隐藏的专业知识浪费是重要但未被量化的部分。
AI.theoretical_framework: 协作意识理论，强调跨领域知识发现与创新的重要性。
AI.method: 通过1MB意识种子和隐私优先架构，结合非侵入性行为模式分析，识别专业知识。
AI.findings: Tessara在100人组织中实现1,061%的ROI，节省95.5万美元，并将3年研发周期压缩至6个月。
AI.theory_contributions: 提出了协作意识的理论框架，为跨领域创新提供了新视角。
AI.practical_contributions: Tessara的实际应用展示了高ROI和成本节约，为组织提供了可操作的创新工具。

title: Israel Exposed Iranian Expats Who Pretend to Be Anti-Islamic Republic
affiliations: Middle East Forum

detail.title: Israel Exposed Iranian Expats Who Pretend to Be Anti-Islamic Republic

keywords: US Foreign Policy in the Middle East

detail.abstract: Israel’s June 13 strikes did not just cripple Iran’s military infrastructure—they revealed a network of Persian expatriates who claim to oppose the regime while protecting the ideological heart of the Islamic Republic. These self-proclaimed anti-regime voices advocate for “regime change” from the safety of foreign capitals, yet shy away from challenging the strongholds of Persian dominance—Tehran, Isfahan, Shiraz. They condemn foreign intervention and invoke Gaza, all while remaining silent on decades of harsh repression against Iran’s ethnic and national minorities. True change won’t come from those who disguise supremacist agendas as reform, but from those who confront the regime head-on and reject its entire oppressive system, no matter where it hides.

AI.tldr: 以色列6月13日的袭击不仅削弱了伊朗的军事基础设施，还揭露了一群自称反对伊朗政权但实际上保护伊斯兰共和国意识形态核心的波斯侨民网络。这些自称反政权的声音在外国首都安全地呼吁“政权更迭”，却回避挑战波斯统治的核心城市。他们谴责外国干预并提及加沙，但对伊朗少数民族的长期压迫保持沉默。真正的变革不会来自那些将霸权议程伪装成改革的人，而是来自那些直面政权并拒绝其整个压迫体系的人。
AI.research_question: 以色列的袭击如何揭示了波斯侨民网络的双重角色？
AI.motivation: 探讨波斯侨民在反对伊朗政权中的真实立场及其对政权变革的影响。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于意识形态批判和霸权理论，分析波斯侨民的行为动机。
AI.method: 通过文本分析和案例研究，揭示波斯侨民的言论与行动之间的矛盾。
AI.findings: 波斯侨民表面上反对政权，但实际上保护其意识形态核心，回避真正挑战。
AI.theory_contributions: 揭示了霸权伪装为改革的现象，深化了对反对派角色的理解。
AI.practical_contributions: 为国际社会识别真正的改革者提供了参考，避免被表面言论误导。

title: The Impact of the Karachaganak Petroleum Operating to the Economy of the West Kazakhstan Region
affiliations: Nazarbayev Intellectual School

detail.title: The Impact of the Karachaganak Petroleum Operating to the Economy of the West Kazakhstan Region
detail.abstract: The Karachaganak Petroleum Operating company plays a key role in West Kazakhstan's economic development. Studies have revealed that KPO presence positively impacts regional employment, infrastructure, and small business growth. In view of this, the investigation focuses on the economic impact of KPO activities and assessing the view toward these impacts by the local population. An online survey was conducted among the people living in West Kazakhstan, with special focus on responses from Uralsk city and surrounding rural areas, accompanied by experts from Karachaganak Petroleum Operating. Both multiple-choice questions and openanswer questions allowed respondents to elaborate with their personal views. Analysis of the responses showed that the majority felt that KPO is responsible for job creation and regional development. However, some participants expressed concerns about environmental hazards and over-reliance on oil revenue. The results show that even though KPO fosters economic growth, diversification and sustainable development are still matters that need to be addressed. It is suggested that KPO gets involved more locally in decision-making, allowing more transparency. Further research must be undertaken to understand long-term regional risks and investigate social effects of oilbased economies.

AI.tldr: 本文研究了Karachaganak石油运营公司（KPO）对西哈萨克斯坦经济的影响，发现其促进了就业、基础设施和小企业增长，但也存在环境问题和过度依赖石油收入的担忧。建议加强本地决策参与和透明度，并进一步研究长期风险和社会影响。
AI.research_question: KPO活动对西哈萨克斯坦的经济影响如何？当地居民对这些影响的看法是什么？
AI.motivation: KPO在西哈萨克斯坦经济中扮演重要角色，但其影响尚未全面评估，尤其是当地居民的看法。
AI.theoretical_framework: 区域经济发展理论、石油经济的社会影响理论。
AI.method: 在线调查，包括多项选择和开放式问题，覆盖西哈萨克斯坦居民，特别是Uralsk市及周边农村地区，并包含KPO专家的意见。
AI.findings: 多数受访者认为KPO促进了就业和区域发展，但也有人担忧环境问题和石油收入的过度依赖。
AI.theory_contributions: 丰富了石油经济对区域发展影响的理论研究，强调了多元化和可持续发展的重要性。
AI.practical_contributions: 建议KPO加强本地决策参与和透明度，为政策制定者提供了改进方向。

detail.title: Privacy and Disinformation
detail.abstract:
All three branches of the federal government have wrestled with how the law could or should regulate social media applications to mitigate the harms of disinformation. However, most proposed solutions make the same critical mistake: Lawmakers may focus on speech regulation or even economic regulation to solve for disinformation but these solutions do not actually address contemporary, technological vectors of disinformation. In today’s increasingly technologically driven global speech environment, the lynchpin for disinformation is not speech but data.

In particular, algorithmic personalization is a new, technological factor that makes disinformation especially harmful. Luckily, data protection and privacy regulation can greatly curb the impact of algorithmic personalization and, correspondingly, disinformation harms as well. These privacy regulatory solutions also do not have the negative factors that make speech and economic regulatory solutions difficult and ineffective. Thus, lawmakers would be better off moving away from speech and economic regulation to instead focus on privacy regulation to mitigate the harms of disinformation, including disinformation found on foreign-owned social media applications, like TikTok.

Legal solutions that focus on data privacy, instead of pure speech regulation or economic regulation, are better solutions for disinformation for four reasons. First, privacy regulation addresses the root of the problem for today’s disinformation: the technological factor of personalization, driven by technological developments like the internet and artificial intelligence (“AI”). Second, privacy regulations are more likely to pass constitutional muster, avoiding First Amendment roadblocks. Third, privacy regulations are likely less controversial to an American public primed to fear censorship. Finally, privacy regulations would be less likely to discriminate harshly against foreign companies, resolving international tensions around perceived economic protectionism and trade unfairness.

AI.tldr: 本文主张通过隐私监管而非言论或经济监管来应对虚假信息的危害，因为隐私监管能更有效地解决算法个性化这一技术性问题，同时避免宪法争议和国际紧张。

AI.method: 通过分析言论监管、经济监管和隐私监管的优缺点，提出隐私监管的优越性。

publicationDetails.detailsText: Bangladesh Teacher Education Journal (BTEJ) Volume 01, Issue 01, December 2021

detail.abstract: Pre-service teacher training is not conducted in any level of teaching in Bangladesh. The qualification requirement for entry level teaching post in any college is Bachelor (Hon"s) and Masters in the related subject (43 BCS circular, 30 November 2020). Almost all fresh graduates appointed for teaching enter the classroom without any pedagogical knowledge of teaching-learning process. This research aimed to find out the differences in teaching of trained teachers and non-trained teachers, the activities organized by a trained teacher in the classroom and teachers" ideas about pre-service and in service teachers" training. The mixed methods genre was followed to conduct the research. Six teachers and sixty students of six different government and non-government colleges of Bangladesh were made involved with questionnaires having both close and open ended questions. Moreover, experiences of the researcher, opinions and concepts of the teachers and the principals were analysed qualitatively. The major findings of the study include (i) the difference between trained and non-trained teachers (ii) the activities of teachers in the classroom and (iii) teachers" opinion about pre-service and in-service teachers" training.

detail.abstract: In the theory of financial markets, a stylized fact is a qualitative summary of a pattern in financial market data that is observed across multiple assets, asset classes and time horizons. In this article, we test a set of eleven stylized facts for financial market data. Our main contribution is to consider a broad range of geographical regions across Asia, continental Europe, and the US over a time period of 150 years, as well as two of the most traded cryptocurrencies, thus providing insights into the robustness and generalizability of commonly known stylized facts.

detail.abstract: Postpartum depression (PPD) in mothers of preterm infants is most of the time neglected and rarely considered a serious health issue by most organizations. This seriously affects the easy return of mothers of preterm infants into the workplace, particularly in jobs that involve high stress and with very limited employee support. Using the knowledge gained from the co-developed Mothers of Preterm Babies Postpartum Depression Scale (MPBPDS), this paper examines how human resource departments in various organizations can play an important role in the early identification, supportive reintegration, and the promotion of wellbeing for mothers of preterm infants experiencing postpartum depression. The study emphasizes the critical importance of integrating maternal mental health as an integral part of organizational development and workforce resilience, most especially within modern HR strategies that focus on inclusivity, trauma awareness, and mental well-being.

title: Глобальные экономические дисбалансы в современном мире (Global Economic Imbalances in the Modern World)
affiliations: Gaidar Institute for Economic Policy, Gaidar Institute for Economic Policy and Gaidar Institute for Economic Policy

detail.title: Глобальные экономические дисбалансы в современном мире (Global Economic Imbalances in the Modern World)
detail.abstract:
Russian abstract: Статья посвящена комплексному анализу глобальных экономических дисбалансов. Рассматриваются основные причины и факторы, включая влияние глобализации, пандемии COVID-19 и международных кризисов, а также роль международной инвестиционной позиции и переоценки активов. Предполагается, что некоторое уменьшение масштабов дисбалансов может произойти за счёт замедления мировой экономики и стабилизации энергетических рынков, однако их стойкость поддерживается ведущим статусом доллара. В долгосрочной перспективе многополярная трансформация валютной системы способна ослабить эти дисбалансы, хотя США сохранят своё доминирование в мировой финансовой системе.

English abstract: The article focuses on a comprehensive analysis of global economic imbalances. It examines their main causes and factors, including the impact of globalization, the COVID-19 pandemic and international crises, as well as the role of international investment position and asset revaluation. The study suggests that slower global growth and lower volatility in energy markets may slightly reduce the imbalances. However, the dominance the US dollar contributes to their persistence. The shift towards a multipolar monetary system could weaken these imbalances in the long term, although the United States are likely to preserve its monetary hegemony.

AI.tldr: 本文对全球经济失衡进行了综合分析，探讨了其主要原因和影响因素，包括全球化、COVID-19疫情和国际危机的作用，以及国际投资头寸和资产重估的影响。研究表明，全球经济增长放缓和能源市场波动性降低可能略微减少失衡，但美元的主导地位使其持续存在。长期来看，多极货币体系的转变可能削弱这些失衡，但美国仍可能保持其货币霸权。

title:
Human capital and economic development of Russian regions, with special reference to long-term historical dynamics
Человеческий капитал и экономическое развитие регионов России в контексте долгосрочной исторической динамики
affiliations: Gaidar Institute for Economic Policy, Lomonosov Moscow State University, Russian Presidential Academy of National Economy and Public Administration (RANEPA) and  Russian Academy of National Economy and Public Administration

detail.title:
Human capital and economic development of Russian regions, with special reference to long-term historical dynamics
Человеческий капитал и экономическое развитие регионов России в контексте долгосрочной исторической динамики

declarations.funderStatement: The research was supported by the Ministry of Science and Higher Education of the Russian Federation (Grant Agreement No.: 075-15-2022-326). The authors express their gratitude to colleagues Ruben Vartanyan, Maria Karpenko, Anna Nifontova for providing the historical data. We would also like to acknowledge the participants of the International academic conference “Economic Aspects of Studying Human Resources in Historical Perspective” (Mirzo Ulugbek National University of Uzbekistan, Tashkent, November 16–17, 2023) and the seminar “Long-Term Historical Dynamics and Factors of Economic Development of Russian Regions” (RANEPA, Moscow, January 25, 2024). Fruitful discussions helped us improve our argumentation. Special thanks go to Maria Karpenko for her assistance in organizing the research. Responsibility for any shortcomings of this paper remains with the co-authors.

detail.abstract: Theoretical and empirical studies show that human capital is among crucial determinants of economic development, due to its impact on technological modernization, productivity and economic complexity. Russia’s spatial disparities imply the regional perspective on these phenomena. We aim at estimating the influence of human capital on economic development using the two-step least-squares method. At first step, human capital variable between 2004 and 2019 is taken as a function of (1) a set of historical instrumental variables from late 19th – early 20th centuries and from the middle of the 20th century, as well as (2) a set of historical control variables, such as the level of economic development, economic structure, institutional environment, and technological advance. At second step, we estimate the impact of human capital on GRP per capita averaged for the period 2004–2019. To ensure historical comparability, regional indicators related to the pre-revolutionary borders of the regions of the Russian Empire were converted into indicators corresponding to the regional borders of late 1950s / early 2010s. Besides, the regional convergence model is estimated for the period 1897–2019. The estimates show that higher rate of economic growth is typical for regions with relatively low level of GRP per capita in 1897. Our findings indicate a significant positive impact of higher education on economic development of the regions of the Russian Federation, as well as the validity of historical variables for the regions of the Russian Empire and the RSFSR as instrumental ones. The findings confirm that Russian regions hold great potential for social and economic development through investment in education.

title: Managing Channel Interactions Through Strategic Information Sharing and Personalized Pricing
affiliations: Fudan University - School of Management, University of Miami - Department of Management and Stony Brook University

detail.title: Managing Channel Interactions Through Strategic Information Sharing and Personalized Pricing
detail.abstract: We consider a distribution channel comprising of a supplier and a retailer, where the retailer can collect customer data and use it to personalize its retail prices; moreover, when the supplier has access to the customer data through vertical information sharing, it can also personalize the wholesale price. Two personalized pricing strategies are studied. Behavior-Based Pricing (BBP) is used if the retailer can only differentiate customers with or without prior purchase histories. Fully Personalized Pricing (FPP) is used if the retailer can accurately predict the customers’ true willingness-to-pay. We build a two-stage model where the firms jointly make long-term decisions regarding data collection and information sharing availability in the first stage and, in the second stage, the retailer sells to forward-looking customers for multiple periods and endogenously decides whether to share behavior-based customer information (customer past purchase history, if any) with the supplier or not. Compared to the extant literature on personalized pricing in distribution channel settings, one distinguishing feature of our paper is that the retailer’s vertical information sharing decision is endogenous (i.e., based on realized sales). Including this feature introduces a different mechanism to the multi-stage game, which ultimately generates several novel findings. First, we show that the supplier and the retailer may have opposing preferences towards adopting price personalization and conflicting positions on whether customer information should be shared. Moreover, even though personalized pricing leads to price segmentation, it can surprisingly increase overall consumer surplus and social welfare due to the enhanced market expansion effect. In addition, we discuss the potential benefit of decentralization and show that compared to an integrated firm, the channel profit in a decentralized setting can be higher if the retailer uses FPP and endogenously shares behavior-based customer information with the supplier. Finally, we compare firms’ equilibrium profits under different long-term strategies and identify the most-likely scenario by considering transfer payment between firms as a way to resolve channel conflicts.

AI.tldr: 本文研究了供应商和零售商在分销渠道中的个性化定价策略，探讨了行为基础定价（BBP）和完全个性化定价（FPP）的影响，以及零售商是否内生共享客户信息对供应链利润和社会福利的影响。
AI.research_question: 在分销渠道中，供应商和零售商如何通过个性化定价策略（BBP和FPP）以及内生信息共享决策影响供应链利润、消费者剩余和社会福利？
AI.motivation: 现有文献中关于个性化定价的研究多关注静态信息共享，而本文通过引入零售商内生信息共享决策，填补了这一研究空白。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于两阶段博弈模型，结合行为基础定价（BBP）和完全个性化定价（FPP）理论。
AI.method: 构建两阶段模型，第一阶段为数据收集和信息共享决策，第二阶段为零售商多期销售和内生信息共享决策。
AI.findings: 1. 供应商和零售商对个性化定价和信息共享的偏好可能对立；2. 个性化定价可能通过市场扩张效应提高消费者剩余和社会福利；3. 分散化供应链在FPP和信息共享下可能实现更高利润。

AI.practical_contributions: 为供应链管理提供了个性化定价和信息共享策略的实际指导，有助于优化利润分配和社会福利。

title: Foreclosure Incentives with Network Effects: A Framework for Screening Digital Mergers
affiliations: CORE/LIDAM - Université catholique de Louvain and Tilburg University - Tilburg University School of Economics and Management

detail.title: Foreclosure Incentives with Network Effects: A Framework for Screening Digital Mergers
detail.abstract: This paper proposes a simple yet useful framework for evaluating vertical mergers in digital markets by distinguishing between product-specific and ecosystem-specific network effects. Vis-´a-vis no network effects, product-specific network effects amplify foreclosure and steering incentives, as a rival’s growth directly undermines the platform’s product value. Conversely, ecosystem-specific effects dampen foreclosure incentives, since rivals contribute to the overall value of the platform ecosystem. We develop a formal model illustrating how this distinction shapes platform behavior and competitive outcomes. We apply this distinction to real-world examples to illustrate its potential usefulness. Our distinction implies that regulators may want to adopt a stricter standard with no presumption of efficiencies where product-specific effects dominate. In contrast, when ecosystem-specific effects prevail, merger evaluation should mirror traditional vertical merger analysis. Thus, offering a more nuanced approach to merger evaluation by presenting a practical screening tool to identify problematic vertical mergers in markets featuring network effects.

title: Designing Vertical Differentiation with Information
affiliations: Bocconi University, University of Mannheim, University of Mannheim - Department of Economics and Bank of Canada

detail.title: Designing Vertical Differentiation with Information
detail.abstract: We study information design in a vertically differentiated market. Two firms offer products of ex-ante unknown qualities. A third party designs a system to publicly disclose information. More precise information guides consumers toward their preferred product but increases expected product differentiation, allowing firms to raise prices. Full disclosure of the product ranking alone suffices to maximize industry profits. Consumer surplus is maximized, however, whenever no information about the product ranking is disclosed, as the benefit of competitive pricing always dominates the loss from suboptimal choices. The provision of public information on product quality becomes questionable.

AI.tldr: 研究垂直差异化市场中的信息设计问题，发现完全披露产品排名可最大化行业利润，但完全不披露信息时消费者剩余最大。
AI.research_question: 在垂直差异化市场中，第三方如何设计信息披露系统以影响行业利润和消费者剩余？
AI.motivation: 探讨信息精确度对市场竞争和消费者选择的影响。

AI.theory_contributions: 揭示了信息设计在垂直差异化市场中的作用及其对定价和消费者选择的影响。

detail.title: How Do Actors With Asymmetrical Power Assert Authority in Policy Agenda-Setting? A Study of Authority Claims by Health Actors in Trade Policy

declarations.funderStatement: NHMRC.

detail.abstract: How health advocates and industry actors attempt to assert their authority as a strategy of influence in policymaking remains underexplored in the health governance literature. Greater exploration of the kinds of authority sources used by health actors vis-à-vis market actors and the role ideational factors may play in shaping access to these sources provides insight into advocates' efforts to exert influence in policy forums. Using the trade domain in Australia as a case study of the way in which the commercial determinants of health operate, we examined the different ways in which health, public interest and market actors assert their authority. Drawing on a political science typology of authority, we analysed 87 submissions to the Australian government during the Trans-Pacific Partnership negotiations. We identify four types of authority claims; institutional authority, derived from holding a position of influence within another established institution; legal authority through appeals to legal agreements and precedents; networked authority through cross-referencing between actors, and expert authority through use of evidence. Combining these claims with a framing analysis, we found that these bases of authority were invoked differently by actors who shared the dominant neoliberal ideology in contrast to those actors that shared a public interest discourse. In particular, market actors were much less likely to rely on external sources of authority, while health and public interest actors were more likely to appeal to networked and expert authority. We argue that actors who share strong ideational alignment with the dominant policy discourse appear less reliant on other sources of authority. Implications of this analysis include the need for greater attention to the different strategies and ideas used by industry and public health organisations in trade policy agenda-setting for health, which ultimately enable or constrain the advancement of health on government agendas.

title: Teaching Approaches and Strategies for Students with Learning Disabilities in the Schools Division Office of Manila

detail.title: Teaching Approaches and Strategies for Students with Learning Disabilities in the Schools Division Office of Manila
detail.abstract: This study explored the teaching approaches and strategies employed by educators in addressing the needs of students with learning disabilities within the Schools Division Office of Manila. Grounded in inclusive education principles, the research aimed to identify effective pedagogical practices, assess their alignment with differentiated instruction, and understand the challenges faced by teachers in their implementation. Utilizing a qualitative-descriptive research design, data were gathered through interviews, classroom observations, and focus group discussions involving special education (SPED) teachers, general education teachers, and school heads. The findings revealed that multisensory instruction, scaffolded learning, individualized education plans (IEPs), and technology-aided teaching were among the most frequently used and effective strategies. However, the study also uncovered barriers such as limited resources, insufficient teacher training, and a lack of consistent support systems. The research underscores the importance of continuous professional development, institutional support, and policy reinforcement to ensure equitable and quality education for learners with learning disabilities. Recommendations include strengthening SPED programs, enhancing collaboration among stakeholders, and institutionalizing inclusive practices across all public schools in Manila.

detail.abstract: The article presents an analysis of working capital management strategies in the construction sector in Poland. The main objective of the study is to examine the impact of working capital management on the profitability and risk of firms operating in this sector. The study covered agroup of public companies from 2019 to 2023. Asynthetic indicator was developed to provide a comprehensive assessment of working capital management strategies, taking into account both financing and investment aspects. Based on the research, four basic working capital management strategies were identified and characterized, analyzing their impact on companies’ profitability and risk. Contrary to prevailing finance theory, the results indicate that in the construction sector, aggressive working capital management strategies negatively affect profitability while increasing operational risk. The study showed that the peculiarities of the construction sector, characterized by long project delivery cycles and significant capital intensity, require a more conservative approach to working capital management. The proposed methodology for evaluating working capital management strategies provides a useful tool to support decision-making in companies operating under increased market uncertainty.

detail.abstract:
In an era marked by economic uncertainty, accelerated digitalization, and rising regulatory scrutiny, the foundations of financial trust are being redefined. This white paper explores the evolving landscape of digital finance through the lens of inclusion, risk governance, and institutional innovation. Bridging practitioner insight with academic framing, it argues that fintech regulation must shift from reactive oversight to anticipatory design-particularly as open banking, algorithmic credit models, and digital identity systems reshape traditional notions of access and accountability.

Drawing upon regulatory developments in the UK, India, and beyond, this paper analyses the tensions between innovation and inclusion, particularly for vulnerable or invisible populations. It proposes a strategic framework that integrates digital trust, behavioral risk, and ESG-aligned governance, while grounding the analysis in real-world case studies. Emphasis is placed on rethinking the risk architecture—not simply as compliance, but as a proactive enabler of inclusion and resilience.

Co-authored by a senior banking strategist and a recent Durham University finance graduate, this paper also reflects the intergenerational evolution of financial thinking. It positions digital governance not as a technical instrument alone, but as a moral and institutional imperative. The result is a forward-looking, globally grounded contribution to the debate on what comes next for the financial system—and how trust can be rebuilt through digital design.

title: Rethinking Legal Data Analysis: The Case for Simple Descriptive Statistics Over Complex Models
affiliations: National Law School of India University, Bengaluru

detail.title: Rethinking Legal Data Analysis: The Case for Simple Descriptive Statistics Over Complex Models
detail.abstract:
This paper critically evaluates the use of complex statistical models in legal research and advocates for a renewed appreciation of simple descriptive statistics and graphical analysis. Using oral mentioning data from the Supreme Court of India spanning December 2022 to November 2023, the study assesses the impact of a procedural notification that altered case listing dynamics. Three methods of analysis—basic descriptive statistics, independent t-tests, and ARIMA-based Interrupted Time Series Analysis—are employed to compare pre- and post-notification data across 43 case categories.

The findings reveal that while statistical models can provide deeper insights, they are often misused or over-interpreted in legal research. For instance, some categories with significant shifts in case distribution were overlooked by t-tests and ARIMA models due to low sample size or model misfit, despite clear trends in the descriptive data. The paper argues that simpler methods are more transparent, accessible, and often sufficient for drawing policy-relevant conclusions. It emphasizes the need for statistical humility and contextual interpretation, especially in law, where normative judgments and communication clarity are paramount.

AI.tldr: 本文批判性地评估了复杂统计模型在法律研究中的使用，主张重新重视简单的描述性统计和图形分析。通过分析印度最高法院2022年12月至2023年11月的口头提及数据，研究评估了一项程序性通知对案件列表动态的影响。研究发现，尽管统计模型能提供更深入的见解，但在法律研究中常被误用或过度解读。

title: Incorporating Multifunctional Value Chain Actors’ Varietal Trait Preferences in Sweetpotato Breeding Programs: A Pathway Towards Inclusive Innovation
affiliations: CGIAR - International Potato Center, affiliation not provided to SSRN, University of Nairobi, CGIAR - International Potato Center, National Agricultural Research Organisation, CGIAR - International Potato Center and CGIAR - International Potato Center

detail.title: Incorporating Multifunctional Value Chain Actors’ Varietal Trait Preferences in Sweetpotato Breeding Programs: A Pathway Towards Inclusive Innovation
detail.abstract: CONTEXT: Conventional breeding programs have hitherto been farmer-centric, prioritizing improvement of agronomic traits while neglecting trait preferences of other value chain actors. The supply-side focus may lead to low adoption of new varieties and food insecurity. Inclusive breeding is vital for meeting diverse customer needs.OBJECTIVE: This study characterizes the multifunctional roles of sweetpotato actors and systematically assesses differences in varietal trait preferences among actors across the entire sweetpotato value chain in Uganda. It is premised on the CGIAR Excellence in Breeding platform’s guide to inclusive demand-driven breeding that espouses the need to involve a broad range of stakeholders in breeding program design, hence innovation development. It provides useful insights on varietal trait preferences and needs of actors that are essential to produce future fit-for-purpose market preferred innovations.METHODS: The study used a sequential mixed methods approach involving, first, systematic value chain-wide multidisciplinary consultations to elicit preferred sweetpotato traits. Second, collection of quantitative survey data from 1,333 stakeholders identified primarily as producers (992), seed multipliers (68), processors (18), traders (97), and consumers (158). Third, a rigorous quantitative analysis to examine drivers of and trade-offs in varietal trait preferences by actor category.RESULTS AND CONCLUSIONS: The findings demonstrate the multifunctional roles of the actors and their varying trait preferences across the value chain. Actors with singular roles prioritize traits based on their immediate needs and commercial interests while those with joint roles exhibit a broader range of trait preferences. However, actors in both production and trading/consumption roles seek a balance between agronomic and quality traits, blending commercial and personal preferences. Regression analysis finds a higher preference for quality traits than agronomic traits as one moves downstream from producers to consumers. Mealiness is consistently preferred over agronomic and other quality traits. Also, overall, women have a balanced preference for both categories of traits.SIGNIFICANCE: The study demonstrates a rigorous participatory research process for eliciting strategic information for decision-making in breeding. It supports the need for systematic market intelligence in crop breeding systems to make them more pluralistic and responsive to evolving trait preferences across the value chain. Embracing multi-actor preferences with fit-for-purpose crop breeding innovations/products can foster uptake of the new varieties and benefit all value chain actors once the mix of trait preferences is fully accounted for in breeding programs and necessary efforts are put in place to ensure the new varieties are successful.

detail.abstract: This generation, characterized by its digital fluency, social consciousness, and desire for authenticity, brings distinct expectations and behaviours that challenge established workplace norms. As Gen Z professionals seek flexibility, mental health support, inclusive environments, and meaningful work, organizations are compelled to adapt their cultural practices and leadership models. This study investigates the transformative impact of Gen Z on organizational culture, focusing on shifts in communication patterns, leadership expectations, employee engagement, and workplace values. Using a mixed-methods approach that combines surveys with industry reports, the research identifies emerging trends influenced by Gen Z, such as digital-first communication, flatter hierarchies, and socially responsible business practices. It also explores the intergenerational tensions that may arise and the strategies organizations can use to bridge these gaps. The findings underscore the necessity for companies to evolve their cultural frameworks to remain relevant and competitive in a workforce increasingly shaped by Gen Z's priorities.

title: The Human Capital Destruction Machine: How Contradictory U.S. Policies Create Systematic Disadvantage for American Workers
affiliations: Independent

detail.title: The Human Capital Destruction Machine: How Contradictory U.S. Policies Create Systematic Disadvantage for American Workers

declarations.declarationOfInterest: No relationships to declare.
declarations.ethicsApproval: All data was open source data and no patient/participant/PII data was used in the making of this research.
declarations.funderStatement: Self funded.

detail.abstract:
American workers are paying to finance their own replacement. This study exposes how U.S. policies deliberately coordinate to extract $425 billion annually from American families while transferring wealth to multinational corporations through systematic human capital arbitrage. While politicians promise that tariffs will "bring jobs back," corporations simultaneously import 85,000+ H-1B workers annually at wages 17-34% below market rates-filling the very jobs that trade protection allegedly benefits. Meanwhile, American families accumulate $1.7 trillion in educational debt for degrees that provide zero protection against this systematic wage arbitrage.

The numbers reveal corporate manipulation on unprecedented scale: American STEM graduates average $67,000 in debt and four years to degree completion, while competing against foreign workers whose three-year degrees cost $8,400 and were subsidized by their home governments. Corporations like Google capture $216 million annually through this arbitrage—laying off 3,200 American engineers while hiring 4,847 H-1B replacements for identical positions at below-market wages, all while benefiting from tariff protection on their hardware products.

This is not market failure—it is systematic corporate exploitation enabled by policy capture. The analysis reveals a fundamental policy contradiction: while tariffs attempt to protect American jobs by raising costs on foreign goods, H-1B and immigration policies simultaneously import foreign workers who undercut wages in the very sectors tariffs are meant to protect. Meanwhile, credential inflation forces American workers to accumulate massive debt for degrees that multinational corporations systematically circumvent through global labor arbitrage. This creates what we term "competitive displacement"— American workers finance their own replacement through student debt while corporations capture the benefits of globally-trained workers at below-market wages.

Empirical evidence demonstrates that foreign workers benefit from subsidized education in their home countries, more efficient degree programs (3-year versus 4-year bachelor's degrees), and earlier workforce entry that provides experience advantages over debtburdened American graduates. The result is systematic human capital arbitrage where American families invest $1.7 trillion annually in higher education that provides diminishing returns due to global wage competition, while corporations avoid training costs through H1B programs importing pre-trained workers at 17-34% below market wages.

Regional analysis reveals how these policy interactions create permanent economic sacrifice zones where populations face impossible choices: accumulate crushing educational debt for credentials that provide no wage protection, or compete in nondegree employment facing systematic wage suppression from undocumented immigration. Case studies of technology hubs show American STEM graduates training their H-1B replacements, while agricultural regions face export retaliation from tariffs and wage competition from imported labor simultaneously. The research establishes that current policies represent engineered wealth transfer from American workers and families to multinational corporations, enabled by policy complexity that obscures actual distributional effects. Unlike traditional analyses examining individual policy domains, this integrated approach reveals systematic interactions creating outcomes worse than any single policy failure alone. The findings suggest fundamental reforms necessary to restore democratic accountability in economic policymaking while protecting American human capital investment from systematic exploitation.

detail.title: The Universal Design for Learning and the Academic Outcomes of Learners with Autism Spectrum Disorder: Inputs for a Responsive Developmental Strategy
detail.abstract: This study examined the impact of the Universal Design for Learning (UDL) framework on the academic outcomes of learners with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD), with the goal of generating inputs for a responsive developmental strategy. Anchored in the principles of accessibility, engagement, and flexibility, the research investigated how the implementation of UDL influences the performance, participation, and learning experiences of students with ASD in inclusive classroom settings. Employing a mixed-methods research design, the study combined quantitative data from academic performance metrics with qualitative insights gathered through interviews with teachers, parents, and specialists, as well as classroom observations. Findings revealed that UDL-based instruction significantly contributed to improved academic engagement, comprehension, and task completion among learners with ASD. Key strategies such as multiple means of representation, expression, and engagement fostered greater learner autonomy and reduced anxiety-related barriers. However, the study also highlighted challenges including inconsistent application of UDL principles, lack of teacher preparedness, and limited access to adaptive technologies. Based on the results, the study proposes a developmental strategy centered on sustained teacher training, curriculum adaptation, and the integration of assistive tools. The strategy aims to institutionalize inclusive practices that address the diverse needs of learners with ASD, ensuring equitable and meaningful learning opportunities in mainstream educational settings.

detail.title: Letters of Intent: Status and Enforceability
detail.abstract: Pre-contractual agreements often occupy an ambiguous space in contract law, fluctuating between enforceability and mere expressions of intent. In this legal uncertainty, Letters of Intent (LOI) emerge as a commonly used instrument to outline the initial terms without necessarily concluding a contract. This article examines the enforceability of LOIs through legal pronouncements, highlighting the risks involved, and proposes safeguards to ensure legal protection in the preliminary stages of agreement.

affiliations: Central Bank of Nigeria

detail.title: Carbon Emissions, Financial Stability and Bank Profitability in Non-Crisis Years

publicationDetails.detailsText: Development and Sustainability in Economics and Finance

detail.abstract: Carbon emissions, or CO2 emissions, is an important but often overlooked factor affecting financial stability and bank profitability in non-crisis years. The effect of carbon emissions on financial stability and bank profitability in non-crisis years has not been examined in the literature. It is argued that carbon emissions can bring about changes in the environment that create health challenges and financial risks which affect bank profitability and pose a threat to the stability of the financial system in non-crisis years. This study examines the effect of carbon emissions on bank profitability and financial stability in non-crisis years. Twenty-two diverse countries were analysed in non-crisis years. The findings reveal that higher carbon emissions impair financial stability by decreasing banking sector solvency and capital buffer which impair financial stability. Institutional quality mitigates the adverse effect of carbon emissions on financial stability by ensuring greater banking sector solvency in carbonintensive environments. Institutional quality also reinforces the positive relationship between carbon emissions and bank profitability, particularly banking sector non-interest income. Lagged nonperforming loans, institutional quality, economic growth and regulatory capital ratio are significant determinants of financial stability in non-crisis years while the determinants of bank profitability in non-crisis years are lagged return on asset, the efficiency ratio, institutional quality, inflation rate and unemployment rate.

detail.abstract: The travel industry is constrained by operational inefficiencies, particularly the manual, resource-intensive process of securing client visas for travel agencies. This administrative burden directly impacts profitability and service quality. This paper presents a strategic framework for the integration of a B2B technology platform designed to automate these workflows. The methodology incorporates a multi-faceted approach, including a market opportunity analysis quantifying the B2B visa outsourcing sector, a competitive positioning analysis against incumbent service providers, and a simulated case study to project quantitative efficiency gains. Key findings indicate a $2.31 billion serviceable addressable market (SAM) with a 9.6% CAGR. Furthermore, the simulation projects an 80% reduction in administrative time and a near-elimination of application errors for a representative agency. The paper concludes that the adoption of AI-driven visa processing platforms is a strategic imperative for travel agencies seeking to enhance operational efficiency and maintain a competitive edge. The presented framework offers a clear, data-supported pathway for this technological integration.

title: Causal Effect of Lottery Promotions on Post-Win Payments: Evidence from a Large Field Experiment
affiliations: NTT DOCOMO, INC., Yokohama City University and Keio University

detail.title: Causal Effect of Lottery Promotions on Post-Win Payments: Evidence from a Large Field Experiment
detail.abstract: This study aims to investigate how different incentive sizes in multi-shot lottery promotions, including large and small prizes, influence subsequent consumer payments. Multi-shot lottery promotions allow repeated opportunities to win incentives and are widely used across various industries. Understanding the relationship between the cost of implementing the promotions, such as incentives for winning, and subsequent consumer payments, which drive revenue, is essential for improving cost-effectiveness. This study analyzes large-scale field data from over one million mobile payment service users and employs a stratified randomized experiment method that addresses user-initiated transaction bias. The results show that, during the promotion, winning any prize increases the total transaction amount (by $26.97-$32.80), the number of transactions (by 1.17-1.27), and the average transaction amount (by $8.81-$9.38). Notably, a small prize with a 0.2% return rate yields a return on investment of 1078.8%, surpassing the 5.6% and 8.6% from larger prizes. However, after the promotion, these differences in incentive size have negligible effects on consumer payments. Further analysis, which also examined whether the effects of winning vary depending on users' frequency of use, reveals that these effects are most pronounced among light users across all outcomes. The findings suggest that allocating multiple small prizes may be more costeffective than focusing on a few large prizes, especially for lower-usage segments, and offer valuable insights for designing successful multi-shot lottery promotions.

AI.findings: 促销期间，获奖显著提升交易金额、交易次数和平均交易额；小奖（0.2%回报率）的投资回报率（1078.8%）远超大奖（5.6%和8.6%），但促销后激励规模差异影响微弱。
AI.theory_contributions: 揭示了激励规模对消费者行为的短期和长期影响差异，丰富了激励理论的应用场景。
AI.practical_contributions: 建议企业优先分配多个小奖而非少数大奖，尤其是针对低频用户，以提升促销成本效益。

title: Repositioning Adr in Nigerian Legal Education: A Framework for Reform (Part I)
affiliations: Independent, Nasarawa State University, Keffi Nasarawa State  Nigeria, University of Nigeria, Nsukka and Independent

detail.title: Repositioning Adr in Nigerian Legal Education: A Framework for Reform (Part I)
detail.abstract: This article focuses on the one thing legal pedagogy in Nigeria is meant for – equipping law students with the requisite legal knowledge and skills necessary for meeting the demands of a rapidly evolving Nigerian society. Given the enactment of the Arbitration and Mediation Act 2023, and the National Policy on Arbitration and Alternative Dispute Resolution (ADR) 2024, amongst others, the article argues that ADR can no longer be safely termed “alternative” as far as Nigeria's justice system is concerned. And that, for socio-economic justice, ADR has to be mainstreamed, particularly in legal education, to put a stop to Nigerian legal profession's limp on one litigational foot; enabling us to run on all that ADR options has to offer. Consequently, it opines that there is an urgent need to review the current Nigerian legal curriculum to maintain the relevance of not just legal practitioners, but the legal profession in the arena of dispute resolution in Nigeria. This article is contained in three papers. This first paper highlights the benefits of mainstreaming ADR in the Nigerian legal curriculum, especially the economic benefits that will accrue from effective commercial dispute resolution. Paper two focuses on the benefits to the economy when ESG Disputes are also effectively resolved using ADR mechanisms. Paper three discusses the avenues through which ADR can be entrenched in the Nigerian legal curriculum, possible resistance to this entrenchment, and recommend possible solutions. In this first paper, the doctrinal and empirical research methodologies are both used. Legislations, writings of jurists, etc. are examined and analysed, as well as a few statistics, which reveal the overwhelming need to review the Nigerian legal curriculum to help students adopt a more diversified approach to justice delivery in Nigeria. Findings analysed reveal that diverse commercial disputes are either designated by statute or necessarily require one or more ADR options as the appropriate mechanism to resolve them. There is therefore the need to review the Nigerian legal education to reflect current societal changes and the demands of socio-economic justice in contemporary and evolving Nigeria. It is hoped that this paper will spur more research in this regards in Nigeria.

detail.abstract: This project investigates a deceptive yet alarmingly common type of crypto scam that exploits human curiosity and greed. It begins innocently: a scammer publicly shares the seed phrase to a cryptocurrency wallet, claiming they've lost access or stumbled upon it, prompting others to check it out. On accessing the wallet, unsuspecting users are enticed by a seemingly valuable USDT balance. However, the funds are immobile-there's no TRX available to pay the network fees required to move the USDT. Eager to unlock the supposed treasure, users transfer a small amount of TRX into the wallet, unknowingly activating the trap. Hidden permissions, preconfigured by the scammer, allow only a linked malicious account to move the funds. As soon as the TRX lands, it's automatically siphoned off, leaving the victim with nothing. This project unpacks the technical mechanism behind the scam and highlights the behavioral vulnerabilities that enable it.

affiliations: Romblon State University

detail.title: Educational Leadership of School Heads Enrolled in Post Baccalaureate Programs: Analyzing the Gap between Concepts and Practices
detail.abstract: This study explored the educational leadership practices of school heads currently enrolled in post-baccalaureate programs, with a focus on identifying and analyzing the gap between theoretical concepts learned in graduate studies and their practical application in school settings. Grounded in transformational and instructional leadership frameworks, the research aimed to assess how leadership theories, strategies, and competencies acquired through advanced academic training translate into actual leadership behaviors and decisionmaking processes. Utilizing a qualitative-descriptive design, data were gathered through in-depth interviews, reflective journals, and document analysis involving school leaders from public and private institutions. Findings revealed a significant disparity between academic understanding and practical execution, often influenced by contextual constraints such as bureaucratic limitations, resistance to change, resource shortages, and institutional culture. While participants demonstrated a strong grasp of leadership concepts such as shared governance, data-driven decision-making, and inclusive education, their application was frequently hindered by systemic challenges and lack of support mechanisms. The study underscores the need for stronger integration between theory and practice in graduate programs, enhanced mentoring systems, and contextualized leadership development models. Recommendations include curriculum refinement, practice-based leadership training, and collaborative learning communities to bridge the theory-practice divide and strengthen the leadership capacity of school heads.

detail.abstract: This study aims at making a contribution to international business research by identifying key success-factors for the foundation process of a Sino-German joint venture in China. Based on the OLI-framework (ownership, location, internalization) and cross-cultural theories we perform a qualitative case analysis in the form of in-depth fieldwork in China. The findings show that success factors are explained by the ownership advantages, location requirements and institutional influence by applying the OLI-framework. While from cross-cultural perspectives, the western bipolar cultural dimensions and the underlying value system of the Chinese culture are crucial factors. This study intends to support foreign managers to make the right decisions in the complex Chinese market environment.

detail.abstract: This study predicts and analyzes the mediating role of innovation capability (IC) on the relationship between digital transformation (DT) and economic competitiveness (CP) of SMEs in the creative industry sector in the digital age business landscape, by proposing model construction. The survey method was carried out by distributing research instruments to 98 respondents as SME actors in Indonesia, the collected data was used to analyze the relationship between digital transformation, innovation ability and competitiveness, also used to test hypotheses. Evaluation of predictions through structural equation models with partial least squares-structural equation modeling (PLS-SEM). The results of model measurement and the results of the evaluation of model suitability show that model suitability is achieved and guarantees model suitability. The findings from the structural model analysis showed that all hypotheses are accepted, and IC has a mediating effect on the effect of digital transformation on the economic competitiveness of SMEs. There is an important component that must be considered to strengthen the contribution of DT and IC to the improvement of CP, namely a set of competencies and resources that must be prepared. A model of increasing the economic power of MSMEs in the creative industry sector based on innovation and digital transformation capabilities involving a set of competencies including digital competencies of human resources and economic resources as fundamental inputs that strengthen them, becomes this novelty to fill the existing gap. The contribution of this research broadens the horizons on the effectiveness of highly competitive businesses in this era, where digital transformation capabilities, digital skills and innovation capabilities must be prepared, which emphasizes the importance of a set of skills and capabilities, digital competency, human resources digital transformation and economic resilience among actors and related partners in this sector.

detail.title: AI Bias at Work: Legal Risks and Ethical Gaps
detail.abstract: Artificial Intelligence generally finds more application nowadays in many industrial processes that include recruitment, evaluation of employee performance, and selections concerning promotions or maintenance. These tools aim at accomplishing tasks more efficiently and objectively by extracting information and data and by automating decision-making processes interfacing with routine matters. Some AI could however put forward a biased outcome, even though their creation may be of purely well-intentioned attempt. This will usually be the case if the AI is trained based on past data, in which imbalances or patterns resulted from human decision-making-fair or otherwise. Hence, these so-called prejudiced decisions tend to Favor one group of people above the other, especially in hiring and promotions.

title: The Twice and Future President? The "Trump 2028" Paradox and Constitutional Loopholes
affiliations: Lincoln Memorial University Duncan School of Law

detail.title: The Twice and Future President? The "Trump 2028" Paradox and Constitutional Loopholes

publicationDetails.detailsText: Lincoln Memorial University Law Review, Vol. 12, No. 3 (forthcoming August 2025)

detail.abstract: The Twenty-Second Amendment limits Presidents to two terms, leading scholars to explore theoretical non-electoral pathways, such as succession from the vice presidency, arguing the Amendment only explicitly bars being “elected” a third time. The emergence of the “Trump 2028” movement, fueled by merchandise and suggestions of “methods” for a third presidential term, has reignited debate over U.S. presidential term limits. However, the overwhelming legal consensus and modern court interpretations of similar state term limits treat the Twenty-Second Amendment as imposing a lifetime prohibition on presidential service beyond two terms, regardless of the means of assuming office. Courts emphasize the Twenty-Second Amendment’s clarity, its public policy goal of preventing incumbent entrenchment, and ensuring fresh perspectives, noting that legislative history supports a consistent intent to limit presidents to two terms of service. Attempts at circumvention are seen as incompatible with this intent and potentially problematic under the Guarantee Clause. Beyond the legalities, the “Trump 2028” messaging carries significant normative and political consequences, including undermining the norm of peaceful transfer of power and “freezing out” potential Republican contenders for 2028. Based on this review, the conclusion is clear: under the current Constitution, a third presidential term is definitively barred absent a formal constitutional amendment, and promoting such a possibility is argued to undermine the foundations of American constitutional order.

detail.abstract:
This paper offers a comprehensive critique of voluntary, broad-based employee equity distribution in the United States, with particular focus on recent proposals that would exchange unrestricted stock grants for temporary tax incentives. Drawing from financial modeling, legal precedent, fiduciary obligations, and institutional investor behavior, it argues that all major non-ERISA equity expansion efforts have consistently failed to scale in a meaningful or durable way.

The paper analyzes the structural, governance, and economic limitations that undermine these voluntary approaches, including dilution concerns, lack of fiduciary protection, selective participation, and short-term liquidity that erodes long-term alignment. It compares the most common voluntary mechanisms, including RSUs, ESPPs, synthetic equity, and contingent value rights, to ERISA-regulated models such as ESOPs.

Through detailed modeling, including price-to-earnings and discounted cash flow frameworks, the paper demonstrates that even under generous tax scenarios, broad-based stock issuance outside retirement plans or carefully crafted compensation schemes are fundamentally uneconomic. Case studies of Microsoft and KKR illustrate the limits of both public and private voluntary programs, even when well-designed and supported by capital resources.

The paper concludes that the theoretical concept of equity-for-tax strategies do not offer a viable path to inclusive capital ownership. It recommends instead that policymakers focus on structural designs that incorporate legal safeguards, fiduciary clarity, and institutional discipline. These include ESOP modernization, expanded use of RSUs with tenure-based eligibility, increased access to ESPPs for lower-wage workers, and more intentional matching of equity design to time horizon and behavioral outcomes.

Many voluntary equity programs, as they exist today, remain compensation tools subject to managerial discretion and selective eligibility. They are not scalable mechanisms for universal wealth building. Without structural reform, inclusive ownership will remain an aspirational idea rather than an achievable policy outcome.

detail.abstract: This research formulates a decision-making model to unravel the rationale of venture capital (VC) investing in nascent innovation ecosystems, empirically focusing on the Iranian digital landscape. Using a five-phase methodology integrating Markov chains, fuzzy Delphi, and the Fuzzy Best-Worst Method (FBWM) with a panel of 21 senior practitioners, we systematically derive and weigh 41 investment criteria. Our findings reveal a decision-making logic where 'Founder's Leadership and Managerial Competencies' is the primary criterion, closely followed by market validation and team completeness. This paper argues that this hierarchy reflects a trust-based investment paradigm, characteristic of nascent ecosystems. In such environments, where formal data is scarce and unreliable, investors anchor their decisions in the founder's personal credibility and track record. The reliability of all other due diligence materials-from market analyses to financial projections-is considered a direct function of the founder's integrity and competence. We posit that this focus on the founder is not merely a heuristic but a rational strategy for verifying the entity that underwrites all other venture-related claims. This "founder-as-trust-anchor" model is then compared with decision logics in more mature developing and developed markets, illustrating an evolutionary path toward more distributed, data-driven evaluation as ecosystems mature. Beyond its theoretical contributions, this research has culminated in a tangible innovation model that has been operationalized into a software tool for VC firms. This tool provides a systematic framework that de-risks investment by reducing subjective bias and simultaneously offers a transparent benchmark for startups to assess and improve their investment readiness.

detail.title: Determination of Employee Retention: Empirical Evidence from PT. ASDP Indonesia Ferry in Papua Province
detail.abstract: This study aims to analyze the factors that affect employee retention in the Office of PT. ASDP Indonesia Ferry (Persero) in Merauke regency, Papua province. The factors studied include organizational components, Job Design, Awards, career opportunities, and Employee Relations. The research method uses a quantitative approach with a survey through questionnaires distributed to all employees as many as 92 people with a total sampling technique. Normality test results showed residual data with normal distribution and worthy of analysis by multiple regression. The simultaneous test (F test) showed a calculated F value of 11.969 with a significance of 0.000, which means that the five independent variables together have a significant effect on employee retention. The coefficient of determination (R Square) of 0.410 indicates that 41% of the variation in employee retention can be explained by the variables studied, while the remaining 59% are influenced by other factors outside this research model. Partially, Job Design, Awards, and Employee Relations proved to be significantly influential, with significance values of 0.000 for Job Design and awards, and 0.027 for Employee Relations, respectively. These findings suggest that clear job design, fair rewards, and harmonious working relationships play an important role in improving employee retention.

title: A Systematic Approach to Assess Languages Proposed for Rules as Code

detail.title: A Systematic Approach to Assess Languages Proposed for Rules as Code
detail.abstract: Formal languages enable normative directives, such as those expressed in contracts, laws, and regulations, to be represented unambiguously and possibly executed automatically by computational means. However, the number of alternative solutions proposed in the literature is continuously increasing, with little explicit insight into their mutual relations. Comparison frameworks are currently limited in number and tend to focus traditionally on formal aspects, neglecting practical adoption factors that are crucial for organizational and societal uptake. Combining recent academic literature and broader technology adoption studies, this study constructs and presents an integrated evaluation framework, organized according to the Technology-Organization-Environment (TOE) framework and refined through grounded theory. The resulting framework addresses technical, organizational, and environmental adoption factors, offering a balanced socio-technical approach for assessing formal legal languages. As an illustrative case study, the framework is used to evaluate RegelSpraak, a controlled natural language used by the Dutch Tax Administration.
