detail.abstract: This paper provides a comprehensive, technical, and methodologically rich examination of the design and econometric evaluation of factor-based asset pricing models, which form the foundation of modern financial economics and quantitative finance. Covering the historical context from the Capital Asset Pricing Model (CAPM) to contemporary multifactor and machine learning-driven models, it rigorously details the economic rationale behind factor selection, formal mathematical specifications, practical data protocols, and state-of-the-art econometric approaches such as time-series, cross-sectional, panel, and GMM-based estimation. The work offers step-by-step procedures for empirical implementation, robust statistical and diagnostic testing, and explores advanced topics, including applications in portfolio management, international finance, and emerging computational methodologies. The paper concludes with a critical assessment of challenges, limitations, and future research avenues, aiming to serve as a definitive guide for advanced practitioners and scholars in empirical asset pricing.

AI.tldr: 本文对基于因子的资产定价模型的设计和计量经济学评估进行了全面、技术性和方法论丰富的研究，涵盖了从CAPM到当代多因子和机器学习驱动模型的历史背景，详细介绍了因子选择的经济原理、数学规范、数据协议以及先进的计量经济学方法。
AI.research_question: 如何设计和计量经济学评估基于因子的资产定价模型？
AI.motivation: 基于因子的资产定价模型是现代金融经济学和量化金融的基础，但其设计和评估方法需要系统化的技术和方法论支持。
AI.theoretical_framework: 资本资产定价模型（CAPM）、多因子模型、机器学习驱动模型。
AI.method: 时间序列、横截面、面板数据、广义矩估计（GMM）等计量经济学方法。
AI.findings: 提供了因子选择的经济原理、数学规范、数据协议及实证实施步骤，并探讨了在投资组合管理、国际金融和新兴计算方法中的应用。
AI.theory_contributions: 系统化总结了基于因子的资产定价模型的理论框架和方法论，为未来研究提供了方向。
AI.practical_contributions: 为高级从业者和学者提供了实证资产定价的实用指南，包括数据协议和统计测试方法。

title: Climate Change and Agricultural Production Nexus: Examining the Moderating Role of Policy Effectiveness
affiliations: Stellenbosch University

detail.title: Climate Change and Agricultural Production Nexus: Examining the Moderating Role of Policy Effectiveness
detail.abstract: Aligned with the 2030 United Nations Development Goals (SDGs) 2 and 13, which aim to achieve "sustainable agriculture to end hunger" and "climate action to combat climate change risk factors," this study sets out to investigate the direct impact of climate change on agriculture and the moderation effect of public policy effectiveness-a deep determinant of growth, on the aforementioned relationship in the most agriculture-dependent countries in Africa and Asia. For this purpose, we constructed a strongly balanced long-macro-panel dataset spanning 1990 to 2021 from Climate Watch, World Bank and United Nations databases. To ensure robust empirical findings, three estimators were employed in this study: the Mean Group (MG), Pool Mean Group (PMG), and Dynamic Fixed Effect (DFE). Controlling for temporal determinants of growth, estimation results for the full-sample find that the coefficient of climate change (carbon emission) exhibits a negative, elastic (2.48), and statistically significant impact on agriculture. Similarly, policy effectiveness exhibited an elastic negative impact on agriculture in the short run, which we attributed to an impact lag. The major contribution of the study is the finding of a long-run counteracting effect of policy effectiveness on climate change's long-run adverse impact on agriculture output. In addition, sub-sample comparative analyses were also conducted in Africa and Asia. While the results align with the full sample model, minor differences were observed in the contradictory impact of human capital and policy effectiveness. The study provides various recommendations, such as investments in drought-resistant crops, alignment of agricultural policies with sectoral needs, and governance stability for dealing with political transitions.

AI.tldr: 本研究探讨了气候变化对农业的直接影响及公共政策有效性在非洲和亚洲农业依赖国家的调节作用，发现政策有效性在长期能抵消气候变化对农业的负面影响。
AI.research_question: 气候变化如何直接影响农业？公共政策有效性如何调节这种影响？
AI.motivation: 基于联合国2030年可持续发展目标（SDGs 2和13），研究旨在解决可持续农业和气候行动的挑战。
AI.theoretical_framework: 气候变化与农业关系的理论框架，公共政策作为调节变量的作用。
AI.method: 使用1990-2021年的面板数据，采用Mean Group (MG)、Pool Mean Group (PMG)和Dynamic Fixed Effect (DFE)三种估计方法。
AI.findings: 气候变化（碳排放）对农业有显著的负面影响；政策有效性在短期对农业有弹性负向影响，但在长期能抵消气候变化的负面影响。
AI.theory_contributions: 揭示了政策有效性在长期调节气候变化对农业影响的机制。
AI.practical_contributions: 建议投资抗旱作物、调整农业政策与部门需求一致、保持治理稳定性以应对政治过渡。

title: Medical Debt and Insufficient Sleep Among U.S. Adults
affiliations: Augusta University and Valdosta State University - Langdale College of Business Administration

detail.title: Medical Debt and Insufficient Sleep Among U.S. Adults

declarations.declarationOfInterest: Authors declare no conflict of interest.
declarations.ethicsApproval: This study used publicly available anonymized data that met the NIH definition of exempt human subjects research (exemption 4).
declarations.funderStatement: No funding was received for this research.

detail.abstract: Medical financial hardship and debt are rising public health concerns in the United States. According to a recent estimate the burden of medial debt in the US is approximately USD 220 billion. This study examines whether inability to pay medical debt is associated with insufficient sleep or short sleep duration (i.e., average sleep duration of ≤ 6 hours) among US adults during pre-(2011-2013) and post-(2015-2018) Affordable Care Act (ACA) and in the aftermath of the COVID-19 pandemic (2022 and 2024). Due to varied lived experiences and age-related differences in health issues and insurance coverage, assessments were performed by generations-boomers, generation X, and millennials. Furthermore, since both medical debt and sleep health are tied with socioeconomic positions, a naïve analysis may not capture the true association. We tried to overcome this problem by separately investigating the relationship across disaggregated income levels and performing random effect meta-analyses to obtain an overall estimate of the relationship for each generation. Nationally representative data from 2011 to 2013, 2015 to 2018, and 2022 and 2024 waves of the National Health Interview Survey (NHIS) were used to assess the relationship across 10 income subgroups within each generation. Robustness was checked through sub-sample analyses by sex. Sensitivity analyses were performed by considering a categorical specification of problems paying medical bills (i.e., no problems paying, had problems but were able to pay, and had problems and were unable to pay) instead of the binary inability to pay indicator. Results suggested that medical debt was generally associated with a greater risk of insufficient sleep among U.S. adults of all generations in both pre-and post-ACA periods as well as after the COVID-19 pandemic.

AI.tldr: 本研究探讨了美国成年人在《平价医疗法案》（ACA）实施前后及COVID-19大流行后，医疗债务支付困难与睡眠不足（≤6小时）之间的关系。研究发现，医疗债务普遍增加了各代成年人睡眠不足的风险。
AI.research_question: 医疗债务支付困难是否与美国成年人在ACA实施前后及COVID-19大流行后的睡眠不足相关？
AI.motivation: 医疗债务和睡眠不足是日益严重的公共卫生问题，研究其关联有助于理解经济压力对健康的影响。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于社会经济地位与健康关系的理论，探讨医疗债务对睡眠的影响。
AI.method: 使用2011-2013、2015-2018及2022-2024年NHIS数据，按代际和收入分组进行随机效应荟萃分析。
AI.findings: 医疗债务普遍增加了各代成年人睡眠不足的风险。
AI.theory_contributions: 验证了经济压力对睡眠健康的负面影响，补充了健康不平等理论。
AI.practical_contributions: 为政策制定者提供了改善医疗债务和睡眠健康的依据。

title: Trading Model for Actively Managed Investment Funds in the Crypto Asset Market
affiliations: Independent

detail.title: Trading Model for Actively Managed Investment Funds in the Crypto Asset Market
detail.abstract: The investment portfolio is mainly exposed to two types of risk: systematic and idiosyncratic. Therefore, the task can be divided into two parts. The first part of the task is to implement the effective set of possible investment portfolios by Gary Markowitz (Sharpe W.F., 2022). However, according to research results, an author’s adjustment “Scam coefficient” should be added in order to increase the efficiency. The second part of the task is to construct an oscillator to reduce systematic risk. The first part is designed to reduce the idiosyncratic risk of the portfolio. Adding a special index is simply necessary since the crypto asset market is affected by many more factors than classical financial markets.

AI.tldr: 本文探讨了投资组合中的系统性风险和非系统性风险，提出通过Markowitz有效集和调整“Scam系数”来优化投资组合效率，并构建振荡器以降低系统性风险。
AI.research_question: 如何通过调整投资组合策略降低系统性风险和非系统性风险？
AI.motivation: 加密货币市场受多种因素影响，传统的投资组合理论需要调整以提高效率。
AI.theoretical_framework: Markowitz有效集理论和“Scam系数”调整。
AI.method: 1. 实施Markowitz有效集；2. 添加“Scam系数”调整；3. 构建振荡器降低系统性风险。
AI.findings: 通过调整“Scam系数”和构建振荡器，可以有效降低投资组合的风险。
AI.theory_contributions: 扩展了Markowitz理论在加密货币市场的应用。
AI.practical_contributions: 为加密货币投资者提供了降低风险的具体方法。

title: China's Rare Earth Advantage as a Portfolio Allocation Factor: A Maximum Sharpe Ratio Approach
affiliations: Independent

detail.title: China's Rare Earth Advantage as a Portfolio Allocation Factor: A Maximum Sharpe Ratio Approach

declarations.declarationOfInterest: The author declares that there are no known competing financial interests or personal relationships that could have appeared to influence the work reported in this paper.
declarations.ethicsApproval: This research is based entirely on publicly available financial data and does not include human subjects, confidential information, or personal data. Ethics approval was therefore not required, and all analysis complied with standard research ethics guidelines.

detail.abstract: This paper investigates whether China's structural dominance in rare earth elements (REE) and its associated geopolitical leverage can serve as a portfolio factor for asset allocation. We propose a Maximum Sharpe Ratio strategy incorporating rare earth equities, EV supply chains, aerospace & defense, gold, and U.S. Treasuries. Using historical ETF data from January 2018 to July 2025, we estimate expected returns and covariances with a 36-month rolling window and apply meanvariance optimization with quarterly rebalancing. The resulting portfolio achieves a Sharpe ratio of 0.43 compared to 0.73 for the S&P 500 benchmark, highlighting the risk-return trade-offs associated with rare earth exposure.

AI.tldr: 本文探讨中国在稀土元素（REE）中的结构性主导地位及其地缘政治杠杆是否可作为资产配置的投资组合因子。
AI.research_question: 中国的稀土元素主导地位及其地缘政治杠杆能否作为资产配置的投资组合因子？
AI.motivation: 研究稀土元素在资产配置中的潜在作用及其风险回报特性。
AI.theoretical_framework: 投资组合理论、地缘政治经济学。
AI.method: 采用最大夏普比率策略，结合稀土股票、电动汽车供应链、航空航天与国防、黄金和美国国债，使用2018年1月至2025年7月的ETF数据，通过36个月滚动窗口估计预期收益和协方差，并进行季度再平衡。
AI.findings: 该投资组合的夏普比率为0.43，低于标普500基准的0.73，表明稀土暴露存在风险回报权衡。
AI.theory_contributions: 验证了稀土元素作为投资组合因子的可行性及其地缘政治影响。
AI.practical_contributions: 为投资者提供了一种结合稀土元素的资产配置策略，并揭示了其风险回报特性。

title: Democratic Proximity Theory: Autocratic Regimes and the Threat of Neighbouring Democratic Success
affiliations: University of Warsaw

detail.title: Democratic Proximity Theory: Autocratic Regimes and the Threat of Neighbouring Democratic Success
detail.abstract: This article develops and tests the Democratic Proximity Theory, which posits that autocratic regimes perceive democratic transitions in neighbouring countries with shared cultural and linguistic ties as direct threats to their regime stability. Unlike broader theories of democratic diffusion that emphasize geographic proximity alone, this theory highlights how culturallinguistic proximity intensifies the risk of democratic contagion, inspiring opposition and unrest within authoritarian states. Using the Russia-Ukraine conflict as a case study, the article examines how Ukraine's democratization efforts, rooted in a shared Slavic heritage and linguistic connections, have provoked heightened fears in the Kremlin of political destabilization and popular sympathy among Russian citizens. In response, Russia has employed a range of strategies including internal repression, nationalist propaganda, and hybrid warfare tactics to contain the spread of democratic ideals and maintain regime control. The case study illustrates the multidimensional nature of democratic proximity threats, and the sophisticated toolkit authoritarian regimes deploy to counter them. The article further explores the role of migration and diaspora networks as transnational vectors that amplify democratic influence across borders. This research contributes to the fields of democratization and authoritarian resilience by incorporating cultural and linguistic factors into the analysis of regime security and interstate conflict. The findings underscore the importance of identitybased dynamics in shaping political transitions and provide valuable insights for policymakers engaged in democracy promotion and conflict prevention in culturally interconnected regions. Finally, the article identifies directions for future comparative research to validate and refine the Democratic Proximity Theory across diverse geopolitical contexts.

AI.tldr: 本文提出并测试了‘民主邻近理论’，认为专制政权将邻国（尤其是具有共同文化和语言联系的邻国）的民主转型视为对其政权稳定的直接威胁。该理论强调文化和语言的邻近性加剧了民主传染的风险，激发了专制国家内部的反对和动荡。以俄乌冲突为例，乌克兰的民主化努力引发了克里姆林宫对政治不稳定和俄罗斯民众同情的担忧。俄罗斯通过内部镇压、民族主义宣传和混合战争策略来遏制民主理想的传播。研究还探讨了移民和侨民网络作为跨国民主影响载体的作用。
AI.research_question: 专制政权如何应对邻国（尤其是具有共同文化和语言联系的邻国）的民主转型对其政权稳定的威胁？
AI.motivation: 现有民主扩散理论主要关注地理邻近性，而忽视了文化和语言邻近性的作用。本文旨在填补这一空白，探讨文化和语言联系如何加剧民主传染的风险。
AI.theoretical_framework: 民主邻近理论，强调文化和语言邻近性对民主扩散的影响。
AI.method: 以俄乌冲突为案例研究，分析乌克兰民主化对俄罗斯政权稳定的影响及其应对策略。
AI.findings: 文化和语言邻近性加剧了民主传染的风险，专制政权会通过内部镇压、宣传和混合战争等手段遏制民主理想的传播。移民和侨民网络是跨国民主影响的重要载体。
AI.theory_contributions: 将文化和语言因素纳入民主扩散和专制政权稳定的分析框架，丰富了民主理论和专制韧性研究。
AI.practical_contributions: 为政策制定者在文化联系紧密的地区推动民主和预防冲突提供了重要启示。

title: Integrating Happiness Economics and Subjective Well-Being in Policy Evaluation -Evidence from Qatar
affiliations: SRTM University

detail.title: Integrating Happiness Economics and Subjective Well-Being in Policy Evaluation -Evidence from Qatar
detail.abstract: This chapter explores the field of Happiness Economics, an interdisciplinary approach that integrates economic and psychological insights to better understand human well-being. Unlike traditional economic models that emphasise income and consumption, Happiness Economics incorporates subjective well-being (SWB) indicators such as life satisfaction, emotional experiences, and perceived purpose. The chapter traces the historical evolution of happiness in economic thought, from classical philosophers to modern behavioural economics, and highlights key methodological developments, such as the use of large-scale surveys and econometric models (e.g., ordered probit and logit). It examines how happiness data can complement conventional indicators to provide richer insights into issues like inequality, globalisation, unemployment, and public health. The analysis includes empirical evidence from Qatar, where economic indicators such as GDP per capita and unemployment rate are assessed alongside subjective well-being metrics. Despite methodological challenges, including potential biases in self-reported data, the chapter argues that Happiness Economics offers a valuable framework for evaluating policy outcomes and improving quality of life. By emphasizing expressed preferences and subjective perceptions, this approach helps bridge the gap between economic policy and human experience.

AI.tldr: 本章探讨幸福经济学领域，结合经济和心理学视角研究人类福祉，强调主观幸福感指标，并分析其在政策评估中的应用。
AI.research_question: 幸福经济学如何通过主观幸福感指标补充传统经济模型，以更全面地理解人类福祉？
AI.motivation: 传统经济模型过于依赖收入和消费指标，忽视了主观幸福感的重要性，幸福经济学旨在填补这一空白。
AI.theoretical_framework: 幸福经济学结合古典哲学和现代行为经济学理论，强调主观幸福感（如生活满意度、情感体验）的作用。
AI.method: 使用大规模调查和计量经济学模型（如有序概率模型和逻辑回归）分析主观幸福感数据。
AI.findings: 幸福经济学能够提供关于不平等、全球化、失业和公共健康等问题的更丰富见解，卡塔尔的实证研究验证了其价值。
AI.theory_contributions: 扩展了经济学的理论框架，将主观幸福感纳入政策评估的核心指标。
AI.practical_contributions: 为政策制定者提供了新的工具，以更全面地评估政策对生活质量的影响。

title: Numerical Signal Design for Crypto Intelligence
affiliations: Independent

detail.title: Numerical Signal Design for Crypto Intelligence
detail.abstract: This study presents a novel framework that bridges deterministic numerical algorithms with computational finance to support interpretable machine learning applications in cryptocurrency analysis. By applying Newton's method, the trapezoidal rule, and a hybrid Euler-Adams-Bashforth solver, we generate structured numerical features that capture convergence, integration precision, and differential dynamics, respectively. These feature vectors are constructed from both synthetically generated sequences and real AVAX-USD log-return data, enabling a direct comparison between theoretical numerical behavior and marketdriven fluctuations. A deterministic labeling rule, based on the parity of the integer sum of the features, defines class boundaries with geometric regularity, allowing the K-Nearest Neighbors classifier to operate in a feature space shaped by mathematically grounded transformations. The results reveal that classical numerical methods, when applied to financial time series, produce stable, class-separable patterns that are well-suited for local classification and boundary interpretation. Through decision boundary visualization, error convergence analysis, and joint feature interaction plots, the paper demonstrates that numerical approximation techniques can illuminate latent structural signals in crypto price behavior. This framework advances the integration of scientific computing and data-driven finance, offering a new paradigm for understanding digital asset dynamics through the lens of deterministic modeling.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种将确定性数值算法与计算金融相结合的新框架，用于支持加密货币分析中的可解释机器学习应用。通过牛顿法、梯形规则和混合欧拉-亚当斯-巴什福斯求解器生成结构化数值特征，捕捉收敛性、积分精度和微分动力学。这些特征向量基于合成序列和真实AVAX-USD对数收益数据构建，实现了理论数值行为与市场波动的直接比较。基于特征整数和的奇偶性的确定性标记规则定义了类别边界，使K近邻分类器能在数学转换形成的特征空间中运行。结果表明，经典数值方法应用于金融时间序列时，可产生稳定的、类别可分离的模式，适用于局部分类和边界解释。通过决策边界可视化、误差收敛分析和联合特征交互图，论文展示了数值逼近技术可揭示加密价格行为中的潜在结构信号。该框架推动了科学计算与数据驱动金融的融合，为通过确定性建模理解数字资产动态提供了新范式。
AI.research_question: 如何将确定性数值算法与计算金融结合，以支持加密货币分析中的可解释机器学习应用？
AI.motivation: 加密货币市场的高波动性和复杂性需要新的分析方法，而确定性数值算法可能为金融时间序列提供结构化的特征提取和解释性。
AI.theoretical_framework: 牛顿法、梯形规则、混合欧拉-亚当斯-巴什福斯求解器，以及K近邻分类器。
AI.method: 通过数值方法生成特征向量，基于合成和真实数据比较理论数值行为与市场波动，并使用确定性标记规则定义类别边界。
AI.findings: 经典数值方法应用于金融时间序列可产生稳定的、类别可分离的模式，适合局部分类和边界解释。数值逼近技术能揭示加密价格行为中的潜在结构信号。
AI.theory_contributions: 提出了一种将科学计算与数据驱动金融结合的新框架，为数字资产动态的确定性建模提供了理论基础。
AI.practical_contributions: 为加密货币分析提供了可解释的机器学习方法，支持决策边界可视化和结构信号提取，有助于市场行为理解。

title: Model Uncertainty
affiliations: Bonn Graduate School of Economics and IZA Institute of Labor Economics

detail.title: Model Uncertainty
detail.abstract: Mental models help people navigate complex environments. This paper studies how people deal with model uncertainty. In an experiment, participants estimate a company’s value, facing uncertainty about which one of two models correctly determines its true value. Using a between-subjects design, we vary the degree of model complexity. Results show that in high-complexity conditions people fully neglect model uncertainty in their actions. However, their beliefs continue to reflect model uncertainty. This disconnect between beliefs and actions suggests that complexity leads to biased decision-making, while beliefs remain more nuanced. Furthermore, we show that complexity, via full uncertainty neglect, leads to higher confidence in the optimality of own actions.

AI.tldr: 研究探讨了人们在面对模型不确定性时的行为与信念差异，发现高复杂性条件下人们会完全忽视模型不确定性，但信念仍反映不确定性，导致决策偏差。
AI.research_question: 人们如何处理模型不确定性？
AI.motivation: 理解模型复杂性如何影响人们对不确定性的处理及其决策行为。
AI.theoretical_framework: 心理模型理论、不确定性决策理论。
AI.method: 实验设计，参与者估计公司价值，通过组间设计操纵模型复杂性。
AI.findings: 高复杂性条件下，人们完全忽视模型不确定性，但信念仍反映不确定性，导致决策偏差。
AI.theory_contributions: 揭示了复杂性如何导致信念与行为的分离，丰富了不确定性决策理论。
AI.practical_contributions: 为设计更有效的决策支持工具提供了理论依据。

title: Green Before the Bell? Environmental Risk and the Decision to Go Public
affiliations: Lancaster University - Department of Accounting and Finance, Lancaster University - Lancaster University Management School and Lancaster University - Lancaster University Management School

detail.title: Green Before the Bell? Environmental Risk and the Decision to Go Public
detail.abstract: We study whether and how environmental risk influences firms' decisions to go public. Using panel data covering US private firms between 2010 and 2020, we find that higher environmental risk is associated with a lower likelihood of IPO. To address potential endogeneity concerns, we use the 2015 Paris Agreement as a quasi-natural experiment and conduct a difference-indifferences analysis, which reinforces the negative impact of environmental risk on IPO likelihood. This effect is weaker for firms with stronger incentives to go public: those with greater information asymmetry or growth potential. We also find that greater climate-related voluntary disclosure in a firm's SEC Form S-1 is associated with a higher likelihood of IPO. However, in the post-IPO years, firms exhibit worse environmental performance while facing fewer compliance penalties, consistent with strategic green washing that limits legal exposure without improving actual environmental performance.

AI.tldr: 研究探讨环境风险如何影响企业上市决策，发现高环境风险降低IPO可能性，巴黎协定强化这一效应。自愿披露气候信息的企业更可能上市，但上市后环境表现恶化，存在“漂绿”行为。
AI.research_question: 环境风险如何影响企业的IPO决策？
AI.motivation: 探讨环境风险对企业财务决策的实际影响，填补环境风险与资本市场行为关系的研究空白。
AI.theoretical_framework: 环境风险理论、信息不对称理论、企业成长理论。
AI.method: 使用2010-2020年美国私营企业面板数据，采用双重差分法（巴黎协定作为准自然实验）。
AI.findings: 高环境风险降低IPO可能性；自愿披露气候信息的企业更可能上市；上市后环境表现恶化但合规处罚减少。
AI.theory_contributions: 扩展环境风险对企业决策的理论影响，揭示信息不对称和成长潜力的调节作用。
AI.practical_contributions: 为政策制定者提供环境风险监管依据，提醒投资者关注企业“漂绿”行为。

title: Environmental and Health Costs of Europeʼs Shift from Gas to Coal Amidst the Energy Crisis
affiliations: Friedrich-Alexander-University Erlangen-Nürnberg and Friedrich-Alexander-Universität Erlangen-Nürnberg, Students

detail.title: Environmental and Health Costs of Europeʼs Shift from Gas to Coal Amidst the Energy Crisis

declarations.declarationOfInterest: The authors declare no competing interests.

detail.abstract: The gas price explosion during the 2021/22 European energy crisis prompted a shift from gas- to coal-fired electricity production. Empirical evidence on the environmental and health consequences of such a fuel-price shock – as opposed to policy reforms – is scarce. We fill this gap by quantifying how exogenous gas price surges reorder coal-gas marginal costs and, in turn, affect emissions and health outcomes. Using daily data (2015–2023) for six EU countries with substantial gas-to-coal switching potential, we estimate a two-stage residual inclusion (2SRI) model to obtain causal effects of days on which gas is more expensive than coal. During the 510 days of the 2021/22 gas price surge when coal was cheaper, coal-fired generation rose by 23% (53 TWh, 95% CI: 43–63), driving a 10% increase in CO2 (36 Mt, 95% CI: 28–45 Mt), 19% in PM2.5 (187 t, 95% CI: 152–222 t), 10% in NOx (8,442 t, 95% CI: 6,573–10,715 t), and 24% in SO2 (16,238 t, 95% CI: 10,947–21,658 t). Applying literature-based damage factors, we find indicative increases in premature deaths and serious illnesses, with additional external health costs exceeding one billion EUR2021. All figures are computed relative to a model-based counterfactual in which gas remained the cheaper option and represent short-term effect that disregard longer-term structural adjustments. The results highlight the substantial welfare costs of fuel price shock-induced switching and inform the design of policies that internalize these externalities.

AI.tldr: 2021/22年欧洲能源危机期间天然气价格飙升导致电力生产从天然气转向煤炭，研究量化了这种燃料价格冲击对排放和健康的影响。
AI.research_question: 外生天然气价格飙升如何通过改变煤炭与天然气的边际成本排序，影响排放和健康结果？
AI.motivation: 现有研究对燃料价格冲击（而非政策改革）的环境和健康后果的实证证据稀缺。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于燃料价格冲击对边际成本排序的影响，分析其对排放和健康的因果效应。
AI.method: 使用2015-2023年六欧盟国家的每日数据，采用两阶段残差包含模型（2SRI）估计因果效应。
AI.findings: 在2021/22年天然气价格飙升期间，煤炭发电量增加23%，导致CO2排放增加10%，PM2.5增加19%，NOx增加10%，SO2增加24%，外部健康成本超过10亿欧元。
AI.theory_contributions: 填补了燃料价格冲击对环境和健康影响的实证研究空白。
AI.practical_contributions: 为政策设计提供了依据，以内部化燃料价格冲击带来的外部成本。

title: Legal Technology and Bias: A Threat to Fair Trial Rights?
affiliations: Ulster University

detail.title: Legal Technology and Bias: A Threat to Fair Trial Rights?

declarations.declarationOfInterest: The author declares no conflict of interest related to this research.
declarations.ethicsApproval: This study did not involve human participants and therefore did not require ethical approval.
declarations.funderStatement: This research received no external funding.

detail.abstract: This paper examines whether bias in legal technology poses a threat to the right to a fair trial, a cornerstone of democratic justice systems. Drawing on examples from the UK, US, and EU, it critically analyses how algorithmic bias in tools like predictive recidivism algorithms, automated visa processing, and facial recognition systems can perpetuate discrimination, undermine judicial impartiality, and erode procedural fairness. Key arguments highlight the 'black box' nature of AI systems, which obscures decision-making processes, and real-world cases such as the COMPAS algorithm's racial disparities and the UK Home Office's biased visa tool. The findings reveal that while legal technology offers efficiency gains, inherent biases, stemming from flawed training data and opaque algorithms jeopardize Article 6 of the European Convention on Human Rights (ECHR) protections in the UK. Existing safeguards, including data protection laws and judicial review, are insufficient due to enforcement gaps and limited transparency. As of 2025, with the EU AI Act partially in force, ongoing developments underscore the need for vigilance. The paper concludes that without robust reforms, such as mandatory bias audits and independent oversight, legal technology risks violating fair trial rights, recommending policy enhancements to ensure equitable integration into justice systems.

AI.tldr: 本文探讨了法律技术中的偏见是否威胁公平审判权，分析了算法偏见在预测累犯、签证处理和面部识别系统中的影响，指出现有保障措施不足，并建议政策改革。
AI.research_question: 法律技术中的偏见是否威胁公平审判权？
AI.motivation: 公平审判是民主司法体系的基石，但算法偏见的潜在危害尚未得到充分解决。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于欧洲人权公约第6条，探讨算法偏见对司法公正的影响。
AI.method: 通过分析英国、美国和欧盟的案例，如COMPAS算法和英国签证工具，批判性评估算法偏见的实际影响。
AI.findings: 法律技术虽提高效率，但算法偏见可能破坏公平审判权，现有保障措施不足。
AI.theory_contributions: 揭示了算法偏见对司法公正的理论威胁，填补了相关研究空白。
AI.practical_contributions: 提出政策建议，如强制偏见审计和独立监督，以促进法律技术的公平应用。

title: Micro-Transaction Economics in TRON Blockchain: A Dynamic Pricing and Resource Allocation Framework
affiliations: Independent

detail.title: Micro-Transaction Economics in TRON Blockchain: A Dynamic Pricing and Resource Allocation Framework

declarations.declarationOfInterest: The author declares no competing interests. This research was conducted independently using publicly available data and standard econometric methods without financial or professional obligations to any blockchain protocols, including TRON.
declarations.ethicsApproval: This study analyzes publicly available blockchain data and does not involve human participants. No ethics approval was required as the research uses only aggregated, anonymized transaction data from public blockchain networks.
declarations.funderStatement: This research received no specific funding from any funding agency in the public, commercial, or not-for-profit sectors. The study was conducted using publicly available data and open-source analytical tools.

detail.abstract: This study presents the first comprehensive microeconomic analysis of blockchain transaction markets, introducing a novel framework for understanding dynamic pricing mechanisms and resource substitution effects in dual-resource blockchain systems. Using 998 daily observations from the TRON blockchain (September 2022-June 2025), I construct a master dataset integrating transaction volumes, resource costs, and network utilization metrics. My methodology combines price elasticity estimation, resource substitution analysis, and welfare optimization models to examine transaction market microstructure in a dual-resource environment. I find strong evidence for resource substitution between energy and bandwidth (elasticity:-0.831, R=0.737), heterogeneous price elasticities across transaction types (TRX transfers:-0.758, USDT:-0.054), and significant congestion pricing effects (t=-13.494, p<0.001). My welfare analysis demonstrates that dynamic pricing mechanisms could increase total welfare by 47.8% compared to current fixed-price schemes. The study establishes the first empirical foundation for blockchain transaction economics, providing evidence for optimal pricing strategies and resource allocation mechanisms in decentralized networks.

AI.tldr: 本研究首次对区块链交易市场进行了全面的微观经济分析，提出了一个理解双资源区块链系统中动态定价机制和资源替代效应的新框架。
AI.research_question: 双资源区块链系统中动态定价机制和资源替代效应如何影响交易市场微观结构？
AI.motivation: 填补区块链交易市场微观经济分析的空白，为去中心化网络提供最优定价策略和资源分配机制的实证基础。
AI.theoretical_framework: 动态定价机制、资源替代效应、价格弹性理论、福利优化模型。
AI.method: 结合价格弹性估计、资源替代分析和福利优化模型，基于TRON区块链的998天观测数据。
AI.findings: 资源替代效应显著（弹性:-0.831），交易类型间价格弹性异质性明显（TRX:-0.758, USDT:-0.054），动态定价机制可提升福利47.8%。
AI.theory_contributions: 首次为区块链交易经济学建立实证基础，验证了动态定价和资源替代的理论模型。
AI.practical_contributions: 为去中心化网络提供优化定价和资源分配的实际策略，提升网络效率和用户福利。

title: Sequential College Admission Mechanisms and Off-Platform Options
affiliations: Toulouse School of Economics, Institute for Fiscal Studies, University of Pennsylvania and Duke University - Department of Economics

detail.title: Sequential College Admission Mechanisms and Off-Platform Options
detail.abstract: The optimal functioning of centralized allocation systems is undermined by the presence of institutions operating off-platform—a feature common to virtually all real-world implementations. These off-platform options generate justified envy, as students may reject their centralized assignment in favor of an outside offer, leaving vacant seats in programs that others would have preferred to their current match. We examine whether sequential assignment procedures can mitigate this inefficiency: they allow students to delay their enrollment decision to potentially receive a better offer later, at the cost of waiting before knowing their final admission outcome. To quantify this trade-off, we estimate a dynamic model of application and acceptance decisions using rich administrative data from the French college admission system, which include rank-ordered lists and waiting decisions. We find that waiting costs are large. Yet, by improving students’ assignment outcomes relative to a standard single-round system, the sequential mechanism decreases the share of students who leave the higher education system without a degree by 5.4% and leads to large welfare gains.

AI.tldr: 本文研究了集中分配系统中因校外机构参与导致的效率损失问题，探讨了顺序分配机制是否能通过延迟学生入学决策来改善分配结果。
AI.research_question: 顺序分配程序是否能减少集中分配系统中因校外机构参与导致的效率损失？
AI.motivation: 集中分配系统中校外机构的存在导致学生可能拒绝分配结果，造成资源浪费和效率低下。
AI.theoretical_framework: 动态决策模型，分析学生在顺序分配机制下的申请和接受行为。
AI.method: 使用法国大学录取系统的行政数据，估计动态模型。
AI.findings: 顺序分配机制显著改善了学生分配结果，减少了5.4%的学生未获得学位的情况，并带来显著的福利提升。
AI.theory_contributions: 为集中分配系统的效率改进提供了理论支持，验证了顺序分配机制的有效性。
AI.practical_contributions: 为教育政策制定者提供了优化分配系统的实践建议，减少资源浪费和学生流失。

title: Suraj Lamps Judgements: The Impact, the Effect and the Aftermath
affiliations: National Law School of India University, Bengaluru

detail.title: Suraj Lamps Judgements: The Impact, the Effect and the Aftermath
detail.abstract: This paper undertakes a comprehensive analysis of the Suraj Lamps judgments delivered by the Supreme Court of India and their enduring impact on property law, particularly the validity of property transfers executed through Sale Agreements (SA), General Power of Attorney (GPA), and Wills. The judgments marked a critical shift in curbing informal real estate practices, aiming to reduce stamp duty evasion, the proliferation of black money, and imperfect titles in property transactions. The paper evaluates the legislative and judicial aftermath, including the invalidation of Asha M Jain v. Canara Bank, and examines how statutory developments like the National Capital Territory of Delhi (Recognition of Property Rights of Residents in Unauthorised Colonies) Act, 2019 reacted to these rulings. It also assesses the practical efficacy of the judgments in tackling systemic challenges such as underreporting of property values, stamp duty leakage, and the persistence of black money, while recognizing the limitations posed by non-scientific guidance values and high compliance costs. Through case studies like Ghanshyam v. Yogendra Rathi and Maya Devi v. Lalta Prasad, the paper explores the evolving jurisprudence on possessory rights under Section 53-A of the Transfer of Property Act and clarifies the role of PoA as an enabling-not transferringinstrument. Further, it interrogates the "obsolescence" argument by comparing how various state-level stamp duty regimes had already addressed some loopholes prior to judicial intervention, albeit without adequately reinforcing the legal distinction between conveyance and mere possession. The conclusion places the Suraj Lamps judgment as a pivotal development in real estate reform-one that prioritizes legal clarity, safeguards socioeconomic property rights, and strengthens the transparency of India's property regime.

AI.tldr: 本文全面分析了印度最高法院的Suraj Lamps判决及其对财产法的持久影响，重点关注通过销售协议（SA）、一般授权书（GPA）和遗嘱执行的财产转让的有效性。判决旨在遏制非正式房地产实践，减少印花税逃税、黑钱流通和不完整产权。
AI.research_question: Suraj Lamps判决如何影响印度财产法中的非正式转让实践及其系统性挑战？
AI.motivation: 研究动机在于探讨最高法院判决对财产法改革的实际效果及其对黑钱、印花税逃税等问题的解决能力。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于财产法理论，特别是《财产转让法》第53-A条关于占有权的规定，以及授权书的法律性质。
AI.method: 通过案例研究（如Ghanshyam v. Yogendra Rathi和Maya Devi v. Lalta Prasad）和立法分析（如2019年德里法案）评估判决的实际影响。
AI.findings: 判决在提升法律明确性和透明度方面取得成效，但仍面临非科学指导价值和高合规成本的限制。
AI.theory_contributions: 澄清了授权书的法律角色（作为工具而非转让手段），并推动了占有权法理的发展。
AI.practical_contributions: 为房地产改革提供了法律框架，减少了黑钱和印花税逃税，但需进一步优化政策执行。

title: Green Fiscal Multipliers with Different Sovereign Debt Trajectories in EU Countries
affiliations: ISEG, Universidade de Lisboa, University of Lisbon, Roma Tre University and ISEG, Universidade de Lisboa - ISEG - Universidade de Lisboa

detail.title: Green Fiscal Multipliers with Different Sovereign Debt Trajectories in EU Countries
detail.abstract: This paper estimates the fiscal multipliers of green public spending using a linear Bayesian Panel VAR and a Smooth Transition VAR framework, with quarterly data for the period 1995Q1–2022Q4 for EU member states. We group EU member states based on similarities in debt trajectories and green spending intensity, forming three regional aggregates: Southern Europe, Eastern Europe, and Northern Europe. Our results show that green spending multipliers on GDP are generally below one, but the response of private investment is significantly stronger — particularly in Southern and Eastern Europe. Multipliers tend to be larger in periods of high public debt, suggesting that green fiscal expansions may be more effective during downturns. Another key finding is that in response to green spending shocks, both long-term interest rates and public debt tend to decline—especially in high-debt regimes—indicating improved market expectations about fiscal sustainability. In contrast, when we estimate the effects of a shock to total public spending net of green spending, we find that both interest rates and debt increase. This suggests that economic agents perceive green spending more favorably than undifferentiated fiscal expansions, likely due to its role in mitigating climate risks, lowering long-term energy costs, and signaling credible long-term policy commitments.

AI.tldr: 本文通过线性贝叶斯面板VAR和平滑过渡VAR框架，估算了欧盟成员国绿色公共支出的财政乘数。结果显示，绿色支出对GDP的乘数通常低于1，但对私人投资的刺激作用更强，尤其是在南欧和东欧。高公共债务时期乘数更大，且绿色支出能降低长期利率和公共债务，表明市场对其可持续性的积极预期。
AI.research_question: 绿色公共支出的财政乘数在不同地区和债务水平下有何差异？
AI.motivation: 研究绿色公共支出的财政效应，以评估其对经济增长、私人投资和财政可持续性的影响。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于VAR模型（线性贝叶斯面板VAR和平滑过渡VAR）分析财政乘数。
AI.method: 使用1995Q1–2022Q4的欧盟成员国季度数据，按债务轨迹和绿色支出强度分组（南欧、东欧、北欧）。
AI.findings: 绿色支出对GDP的乘数低于1，但对私人投资影响更强；高债务时期乘数更大；绿色支出能降低利率和债务，而普通支出则相反。
AI.theory_contributions: 验证了绿色支出的财政乘数效应及其对市场预期的积极影响。
AI.practical_contributions: 为政策制定者提供绿色支出在经济增长和财政可持续性方面的优势证据。

title: Exploring the Impact of Minimum Wage Increases on Crime: An Analytical Assessment Using the Becker Model and Empirical Evidence with Relevance to the UK Context
affiliations: Independent

detail.title: Exploring the Impact of Minimum Wage Increases on Crime: An Analytical Assessment Using the Becker Model and Empirical Evidence with Relevance to the UK Context

contentType.other: Personal research paper as part of UEA's law school

detail.abstract: This paper explores the potential impact of minimum wage (MW) increases on crime through the lens of Gary Becker’s economic model of criminal behaviour, which frames offending as a rational response to shifting incentives. Using this framework as an analytical foundation, the essay examines whether raising the MW can deter crime by increasing the opportunity cost of offending, particularly for low-skilled or marginalised workers. It draws on empirical research from both the UK and the US, finding that while MW rises can reduce crime, this effect is conditional on continued access to lawful employment. UK-based studies provide supportive evidence of crime reduction following MW reform, with little to no disemployment. However, US-based studies show that where MW hikes reduce employment - especially among young or low-skilled groups - crime may increase. The paper integrates refinements of Becker’s model, including Ehrlich’s time-efficiency framework and Braun’s U-shaped wage-crime hypothesis, to highlight the importance of stable, timely access to legal work. It concludes that MW policy may deter crime, but only where it does not undermine employment opportunities. The findings hold relevance for UK policy despite cross-jurisdictional differences, provided that local labour market conditions and demographic exposures are accounted for.

AI.tldr: 本文探讨了最低工资（MW）提高对犯罪率的潜在影响，基于Gary Becker的犯罪经济学模型，分析了MW提升是否能通过增加犯罪的机会成本来减少犯罪。研究发现，MW提高在保持合法就业机会的情况下可以减少犯罪，但若导致就业减少，则可能增加犯罪。
AI.research_question: 最低工资提高是否能通过增加犯罪的机会成本来减少犯罪？
AI.motivation: 研究动机在于理解最低工资政策对犯罪率的影响，为政策制定提供依据。

title: The Impact of Climate Litigation Risk on Firms’ Cost of Bank Loans
affiliations: European Central Bank (ECB) and European Central Bank (ECB)

detail.title: The Impact of Climate Litigation Risk on Firms’ Cost of Bank Loans
detail.abstract: Using a novel worldwide dataset of 5,264 syndicated loans issued to 329 firms from 2006 to 2021, we study how climate-related litigation risk affects firm’s cost of borrowing. We find robust empirical evidence that firms targeted by climate lawsuits pay significantly higher spreads on their bank loans. These effects are more pronounced for firms with weaker environmental performance and higher ESG controversies. The results suggest that lender’s view climate litigation as a material risk factor, which is increasingly priced into debt contracts.

title: Flourishing-by-Design: A Framework for Embedding Well-Being in AI-Driven Innovation
affiliations: Stanford University, Harvard University, Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health, Harvard University, Harvard University and Baylor University - Institute for Studies of Religion

detail.title: Flourishing-by-Design: A Framework for Embedding Well-Being in AI-Driven Innovation
detail.abstract: Big Tech firms face mounting criticism for practices that undermine social welfare, ranging from monopolistic consolidation and attention-maximizing design to the erosion of mental health and civic trust. At the same time, corporate responsibility frameworks such as ESG remain ill-suited to assess the broader societal impacts of digital technologies, particularly due to inconsistent measurement and limited focus on actual outcomes. We propose a new paradigm-flourishing by design-that reorients corporate responsibility around the active promotion of human flourishing through AI-enabled services and platforms. Drawing on empirical insights from the Global Flourishing Study, we argue for a shift from risk-minimization toward outcome-oriented, value-driven product design. The framework advances a set of principles and design criteria that integrate AI ethics (e.g., fairness, autonomy, transparency) with multi-dimensional flourishing indicators (e.g., health, meaning, social connection) into the specification and evaluation of digital products. This approach offers scholars, policymakers, and industry leaders a more comprehensive lens for assessing the ethical performance of all firms and complements existing ESG efforts by anchoring responsibility in the lived experiences and well-being of end users.

detail.abstract: In the contemporary discourse surrounding human rights, global legal pluralism and the multi-level protection paradigm are gaining increasing attention as a response to the complexities of human rights enforcement in an interconnected world. This paper explores how multiple legal regimes-ranging from national to international-interact and function collectively to protect human rights in a multi-layered fashion. Specifically, it examines the role of regional courts, such as the Inter-American Court of Human Rights (IACtHR) and the European Court of Human Rights (ECtHR), in shaping national legal systems. Through a comparative lens, this article analyzes how Latin America and Europe have adopted varying approaches to human rights protection within this multi-level framework. It explores key legal concepts, including inter-legality, conventionality control, and subsidiarity, which underpin the multi-level protection paradigm. The paper also delves into case studies that illustrate how these concepts are applied in practice, such as Gelman v. Uruguay and Kimel v. Argentina (IACtHR), and Dudgeon v. United Kingdom and Von Hannover v. Germany (ECtHR). Finally, it reflects on the evolving role of states, which are increasingly engaging with international norms to enhance their regulatory capacity while maintaining sovereignty in the protection of human rights. The article ultimately advocates for a more integrated and cooperative approach to human rights governance, which combines national, regional, and global legal frameworks.

title: From Chalkboards to Steam Engines: Early Adoption of Compulsory Schooling, Innovation, and Industrialization
affiliations: University of Bergamo and University of Bergamo

detail.title: From Chalkboards to Steam Engines: Early Adoption of Compulsory Schooling, Innovation, and Industrialization
detail.abstract: Empirical evidence on the historical role of Compulsory Schooling Laws (CSL) for the spread of mass education is mixed at best. This is also due to the difficulty of identifying exogenous variation in the application of CSL. We exploit an almost unique feature of a CSL in 1877 Italy which was gradually implemented across municipalities based on the teacher to population ratio. This criterion generates a sharp discontinuity which can be exploited to estimate the causal effect of the early implementation of CSL on economic outcomes. Estimates based on a regression discontinuity design show that CSL had a positive long-term effect on innovation and industrial employment. Consistent with the main objective of the reform, CSL had a positive effect on human capital by increasing enrollment rates in technical schools and, more in general, the literacy rate. The results are robust to a series of placebo, falsification and manipulation tests. This study provides important policy implications in favor of the early implementation of CSL to increase the average level of education which, in turns, brings about positive effects on innovation and industrialization.

title: Domestic Violence in South Asia: Navigating Law, Culture, and Human Rights
affiliations: Independent

detail.title: Domestic Violence in South Asia: Navigating Law, Culture, and Human Rights
detail.abstract: Domestic violence remains a persistent and under-addressed human rights concern across South Asia, shaped by patriarchal social traditions, rigid cultural expectations, and systemic indifference. Despite the presence of legal frameworks in many countries, the gap between law and enforcement continues to leave victims vulnerable and without complete access to justice. This paper critically checks the legal and constitutional responses to domestic violence in select South Asian jurisdictions, focusing on how statutory protections intersect with broader rights to life, dignity, and liberty. It highlights the challenges of enforcement, the role of courts in interpreting constitutional guarantees, and the influence of socio-cultural norms on the effectiveness of legal remedies. It reflects on the importance of integrating international human rights standards into domestic legal systems to better protect survivors. Ultimately, the paper argues for a more holistic, rights-based approach to addressing domestic violence one that combines legal reform with institutional accountability and socio-cultural change. Without meaningful implementation and sustained political will, legal protections risk remaining ineffective, especially for women in rural and marginalized communities.

detail.title: Nutriconnect: Enhancing Health and Food Security Through Sustainable Solutions and Partnerships: Design and Protocol of a Pragmatic Comparative Effectiveness Trial
detail.abstract: BackgroundFood insecurity and poor dietary intake contribute to health disparities, particularly among socioeconomically disadvantaged populations. Produce prescription programs aim to improve access to fruits and vegetables (F&V) for those with diet-sensitive conditions, but comparative effectiveness data are limited.ObjectiveTo compare the impact of two produce prescription strategies, NutriConnect Credit (grocery coupons) and NutriConnect Delivery (home-delivered F&V boxes), on dietary intake, food security, and health outcomes among socioeconomically disadvantaged populations who have been recently hospitalized with diet-sensitive conditions.MethodsIn this three-arm pilot trial, recently hospitalized adults with food or financial insecurity and elevated cardiovascular risk were randomized (1:1:1) to Credit, Delivery, or enhanced usual care. The primary outcome is between group difference in change in F&V intake at 6 months. Secondary outcomes include food security and self-reported health-related quality of life. Implementation outcomes are assessed using the PRISM/RE-AIM framework.ConclusionNutriConnect seeks to provide evidence on the effectiveness and feasibility of two produce prescription strategies to inform scalable "Food is Medicine" programs targeting nutrition-related health disparities.

detail.abstract: We present new monthly city-level and national measures of worker and firm search from 1900 to 1938, derived from scanned images of U.S. newspapers. To our knowledge, we are the first to systematically use the "situations-wanted" advertisements placed by job seekers. We document fresh insights into early 20th-century labor market dynamics: (1) worker and firm search efforts are procyclical; (2) posting costs affect advertising behavior and labor search intensity; (3) the Beveridge curve is stable over the last 125 years, with similar shifts following the 1918 flu and Covid-19 pandemic; and (4) regional and gender heterogeneity exists.

title: From Data to Strategy: A Public Market Framework for Competitive Intelligence
affiliations: Independent, Illinois Institute of Technology, University of Agder, Grinnell College and University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign

detail.title: From Data to Strategy: A Public Market Framework for Competitive Intelligence

contentType.other: accept by Expert Systems with Applications

detail.abstract: This paper introduces a dynamic, mathematically grounded, and fully data-driven framework for competitor analysis, index construction, and industry benchmarking-addressing fundamental limitations in traditional strategic approaches that rely on static classifications, internal disclosures, or proprietary data. Built entirely on publicly available financial signals-including firm-level equity prices, macroeconomic indicators, and sector ETFs-the framework replaces rigid taxonomies with a flexible, behaviorally revealed peer selection mechanism governed by coupled ordinary differential equations (ODEs) and speed-weighted Runge-Kutta integration. A stakeholder-aware thresholding scheme integrates strategic priorities without sacrificing analytical rigor. The resulting industry index is constructed using Self-Financing Hierarchical Risk Parity (SF-HRP), producing stable and interpretable portfolio weights. A Gram-Schmidt orthogonality ensures parsimony among macroeconomic factors (|ρ| < 0.05), enhancing robustness. Forecasting evaluations confirm that CNN-LSTM achieves superior performance (RMSE: 0.028, R²: 0.95), reducing error by over 80% relative to baseline LSTM models, while WGANs capture tail risk distributions (R²: 0.75). Critically, the framework demonstrates that high correlation does not imply redundancy-validated through multiscale residual analysis, information-theoretic modeling, and geometric submanifold representations. At its core, this research introduces the signal-based strategic interaction model, a new theoretical paradigm that reframes financial performance as real-time strategic communication. It establishes a generalized, industry-agnostic system for dynamic competition management-scalable, transparent, and responsive to market shifts-empowering firms of all sizes to identify peers, track competitive positioning, and inform strategy with unprecedented precision and accessibility.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种基于数学和数据驱动的动态框架，用于竞争对手分析、指数构建和行业基准测试，解决了传统静态分类方法的局限性。该框架利用公开财务数据和ODE模型，结合CNN-LSTM和WGANs技术，显著提升了预测精度和风险管理能力。

title: A Plea to Adam Smith Scholars
affiliations: Pontifical Catholic University of Puerto Rico

detail.title: A Plea to Adam Smith Scholars
detail.abstract: My plea to Adam Smith scholars is this: stop citing Adam Smith's Lectures on Jurisprudence (Smith 1978) without proper qualification, let alone a disclaimer. Although this work purports to be a primary source--a transcription of Smith's law lectures at the University of Glasgow--these student lecture notes pose two practical problems. One is that we have no idea how faithful or accurate this transcription of Smith's law lectures is. The other problem is that Smith himself may have repudiated the ideas contained in those early law lectures.

AI.tldr: 作者呼吁亚当·斯密学者在引用《法学讲义》时需谨慎，因其准确性存疑且斯密本人可能已否定其中的观点。

detail.abstract: The increasing sophistication of cyber threats against U.S. critical infrastructure necessitates revolutionary approaches to cybersecurity that can adapt and respond in real-time [15]. This research paper examines the application of artificial intelligence, particularly deep reinforcement learning (RL), for securing critical infrastructure sectors including energy grids, healthcare systems, and transportation networks. We analyze three key technological frontiers: adaptive cyber defense through deep RL algorithms, AI-powered threat intelligence analysis using transformer models trained on MITRE ATT&CK data, and robust AI model training techniques to prevent adversarial attacks. The paper synthesizes findings from recent research and government initiatives, including DARPA CAGE Challenge developments and the 2023 National Cybersecu- rity Strategy, to present a comprehensive framework for AI-driven critical infrastructure protection.

title: Unravelling Business Models Sustainability Opportunities: The Case of Horticultural Farmers in Cartago, Costa Rica
affiliations: Università di Bologna - Alma Mater Studiorum Università di Bologna, affiliation not provided to SSRN, Università di Bologna - Alma Mater Studiorum Università di Bologna, affiliation not provided to SSRN and University of Bologna

detail.title: Unravelling Business Models Sustainability Opportunities: The Case of Horticultural Farmers in Cartago, Costa Rica
detail.abstract: The agricultural sector plays a key role in shaping the transition towards sustainable food systems. However, agricultural producers face dual pressure: to mitigate environmental burdens while simultaniously ensuring the financial viability of their business. Based on a case study in Latin America, a horticultural farmers’ cooperative in Costa Rica sets out to investigate the environmental and economic implications of employing  agroecological practices and identify market barriers and opportunities for sustainable business models for smallholders. The different methods used included the Agroecology Criteria Tool to evaluate the most promising producers from the cooperative, and based on their practices, further research steps were developed. The Environmental Life Cycle Costing (E-LCC) enabled the comparison of the performance of cooperative producers with the business-as-usual scenario, to later internalise environmental externalities through the monetisation of carbon and water footprints. A market analysis facilitated an understanding of the current commercial context, identifying strengths and weaknesses in a co-designed and tailored business model (BM) proposal, which utilised the Business Model Canvas (BCM). The results provide insights into the main challenges and barriers encountered by the case study farmers in improving their sustainability performances and matching business trends and requirements. The E-LCC showed potential in presenting the main focal points in a particular production model, which were further exploited in a BMC design process. Findings can be used as input for further attempts of sustainable agribusinesses through a science-based BM proposal, tailored for horticultural fermers in the Central American region, facilitating their transition towards more sustainable food systems.

detail.abstract: We examine the role of government investment in defense capital as a deterrence tool. Using an optimal fiscal policy framework with endogenous disaster risk, we allow for an endogenous determination of geopolitical risk and defense capacity, which we discipline using the Geopolitical Risk Index. We show both analytically and quantitatively that financing defense primarily through debt, rather than taxation, is optimal. Debt issuance mitigates present tax distortions but exacerbates them in the future, especially in wartime. However, since additional defense capital deters future wars, the expected tax distortions decline as well, making debt financing a welfare-improving strategy. Quantitatively, the optimal defense financing in the presence of heightened risk involves a twice higher share of debt and backloading of tax distortions compared to other types of government spending.

detail.abstract: This document presents an examination of the behavioral factors influencing the financial literacy of youth within Kyrgyzstan. The investigation synthesizes existing literature on financial literacy, behavioral economics, and socio-cultural influences, with a specific focus on their applicability to the Central Asian context. It addresses the critical need for robust financial capabilities among young populations, particularly in developing economies subject to rapid economic and social transitions. The paper outlines a conceptual framework for understanding the interplay between cognitive biases, socio-cultural norms, and educational systems in shaping financial knowledge and behavior. Empirical findings from related regional studies are integrated to underscore the challenges and opportunities for enhancing financial literacy. The analysis culminates in actionable recommendations for policy interventions and educational strategies designed to foster improved financial decision-making among Kyrgyz youth, ultimately contributing to enhanced socioeconomic stability and individual well-being.

title: Paformer: Part Aware Transformer for Person Re-Identification
affiliations: Sogang University, Sogang University and Sogang University

detail.title: Paformer: Part Aware Transformer for Person Re-Identification
detail.abstract: Within the field of person re-identification (ReID), partial ReID methods are widely used to compare body parts between samples and measure feature distances. However, despite extensive research in this area, a significant gap remains: existing methods often lack explicit anatomical guidance, which leads to inconsistent capture of corresponding body-part features across different samples. This shortcoming undermines robust part-to-part matching and ultimately limits ReID performance. To address this, we propose Part Aware Transformer (PAFormer), a pose estimation based ReID model that facilitates precise part-to-part comparisons. To inject part awareness into the model, we introduce learnable parameters called ‘pose tokens’ that estimate the correlation between each body part and image regions. Furthermore, leveraging the enhanced anatomical awareness, PAFormer incorporates a learning-based visibility predictor to assess the degree of occlusion for each body part. Importantly, during inference, PAFormer operates without additional body part localization modules that are typically required by previous pose-based ReID methods. A set of extensive experiments show that our method outperforms existing approaches on well-known ReID benchmark datasets.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了Part Aware Transformer (PAFormer)，一种基于姿态估计的ReID模型，通过引入可学习的‘姿态标记’和基于学习的可见性预测器，解决了现有部分ReID方法缺乏明确解剖指导的问题，显著提升了性能。

AI.practical_contributions: PAFormer无需额外的身体部位定位模块，简化了推理过程，提升了实际应用效率。

detail.abstract: The rapid shift to online education, accelerated by global events such as the pandemic, has underscored the critical need for robust and reliable online examination systems. A significant challenge in this paradigm is ensuring academic integrity and preventing malpractice. Traditional human proctoring methods, while effective in physical settings, are often labor-intensive, costly, and less scalable for remote assessments. This literature review paper systematically examines the advancements in automated online proctoring systems, with a particular focus on the application of deep learning techniques for detecting various forms of malpractice. We delve into different components of these systems, including face detection, multiple person detection, face spoofing, and head pose estimation. The paper synthesizes methodologies, datasets, and performance metrics from recent research, highlighting the evolution of deep learning models such as Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs), Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs), and their variants in addressing the complexities of real-time cheating detection. Furthermore, it discusses the challenges and limitations of current systems, such as the need for more diverse and annotated datasets, ethical considerations, and the constant evolution of cheating strategies. Finally, we propose future research directions aimed at developing more sophisticated, adaptive, and ethical online proctoring solutions that leverage the full potential of artificial intelligence.

detail.abstract: This article estimates the wage returns to different education levels in Germany, France, Italy and Spain by calculating the internal rates of return of tertiary education and upper secondary education and comparing them with lower secondary education. Takeaways • Employment income increases with education level. In the period 2010-2021 Germany was the country with the largest wage differential between individuals with a tertiary education and those with a lower secondary education, followed by France, Spain and Italy. • In these four countries the returns to tertiary education were over 10% higher than the returns to lower secondary education. Germany and France have the highest returns (around 20%), while Italy and Spain have lower returns (11% and 12%, respectively). • Regardless of field, the returns to long-cycle tertiary education are higher than the returns to higher vocational training. In addition, the returns to long-cycle tertiary education in the science, technology, engineering and mathematics fields are higher than in humanities. In all tertiary education specialisations, Germany stands out with the highest returns, followed by France, Spain and Italy.

title: Genocide and International Justice: Legal Accountability in Gaza, Myanmar, and Beyond
affiliations: Amity University Lucknow Campus

detail.title: Genocide and International Justice: Legal Accountability in Gaza, Myanmar, and Beyond
detail.abstract: This paper explores the complex challenges of ensuring legal accountability for genocide under international law. It focuses on recent atrocities in Gaza and Myanmar’s Rakhine State that have triggered serious allegations of genocide. We check what "genocide" means based on the rules set in 1948 and other laws (like the Rome Statute of the ICC, UN Charter, and so on). The paper identifies major jurisdictional and enforcement barriers to prosecuting genocide in modern conflict zones. We sum up the facts for each place: in Gaza, more than 59,000 people (mostly Palestinians) have died since October 2023, and about 1.9 million had to leave their homes; in Myanmar, since 2017, In Myanmar, mass killings and systematic persecution of the Rohingya by state security forces since 2017 have displaced over 1.1 million people. in "clearance" drives, and over 1.1 million had to flee. We analyse how these situations fit the elements of genocide, and how international courts have responded. South Africa has brought a case at the ICJ alleging genocide in Gaza, prompting provisional orders against Israel; Gambia v. Myanmar at the ICJ led to orders compelling Myanmar to prevent genocidal acts and preserve evidence.1 2The ICC has opened investigations into crimes against the Rohingya (with jurisdiction via Bangladesh’s ratification of the Rome Statute)3 and is unable to prosecute Gaza crimes (Palestine’s partial membership does not cover Israeli officials). Our analysis highlights gaps between legal obligations and political realities. We find that we need stronger tie, ups between nations, with global reach and hard actions on ICJ/ICC rules. States must reaffirm their obligations under the Genocide Convention, support independent investigations, and explore innovative mechanisms for accountability, and look into new ways to hold people to account. It's vital to step in now to block more bad acts and keep the "never again" vow of the Genocide Meet strong.

detail.abstract: The Ayushman Bharat - Health and Wellness Centres (AB-HWCs) initiative, launched under the ambit of the Ayushman Bharat Programme, represents a paradigm shift in India's healthcare delivery. detail.title: Idiosyncratic Volatility Factor and the Macroeconomy
detail.abstract: A strong factor structure exists among the idiosyncratic volatilities of assets. This paper introduces an econometric framework to extract the common factor, which we call the idiosyncratic volatility factor (IVF), based on a stochastic volatility model that is straightforward to estimate. Simulations show our estimator outperforms conventional measures like MLE and realized volatility. Applying the methodology on the US stock return data, we find that the IVF exhibits time-varying cyclicality. A Markov-switching model identifies two regimes where IVF dynamics are driven by macroeconomic risks or innovation, respectively. These regime-specific drivers yield distinct economic predictions, highlighting the need to consider volatility sources when assessing its macroeconomic implications.

detail.abstract: CBDC is directly related to existing monetary economics and policy, as it is a form of money. The study examines existing economic theories and concepts, such as the Taylor Rule (Taylor, 1993) and the Interest Theory (Fisher, 1930), concerning CBDC. Furthermore, the study examines interest rates, inflation, monetary supply, and other relevant topics to signify the potential effects of CBDC on monetary economics. detail.abstract: Mental health is recognised under the right to health in Article 12(1) of the International Covenant on Economic, Social and Cultural Rights. This article refers to the gross violation of mental health rights by the South African government, regarding the Life Esidimeni scandal that ended in tragedy. A failed de-institutionalisation policy implementation was to blame. The article further aims to assess the state of psychiatric health care in South Africa, 30 years into democracy. This milestone signifies a litmus test of how South Africa has advanced or not, in protecting the rights of people with mental disorders. An analysis of events after the Esidimeni tragedy suggests that the government must take more robust action to advance the rights of people in mental health care. The author highlights certain challenges towards ensuring that mental health institutions are considered in promoting the right to health. This article examines the theoretical foundations of mental health rights and the background of international and regional law approaches to mental health issues. The right to access to mental health services in South African jurisprudence and the law will be examined as well as the hurdles of implementing this policy. The Esidimeni tragedy and its aftermath will be discussed, followed by submissions and a conclusion.

affiliations: Hertie School, Technische Universität Berlin (TU Berlin), Technische Universität Berlin (TU Berlin) and RWI - Leibniz-Institute for Economic Research

detail.title: The Effect of Framing on Policy Support: Experimental Evidence from Urban Transport Policies
detail.abstract: Do citizens support policy instruments because they appreciate their effects or because they are convinced by their objectives? We administered a large-scale representative survey with randomised video treatments to test how different policy frames-time savings, health and environment-affect citizens' attitudes towards urban tolls in two large European metropolitan areas, Berlin-Brandenburg and Paris-Ile de France. Presenting urban tolls as a solution to air pollution increases support by up to 11.4%p, presenting them as a climate change or congestion relief measure increases support by 7.1 and 6.5 %p, respectively. A causal mediation analysis demonstrates that the observed changes in policy support are mainly framing effects, changes in beliefs about policy effects play a secondary role. Thus, we exhibit a new effect in public opinion about economic policies: Different specified objectives for the same policy design can affect citizen's views differently.

detail.abstract: Gender inequality is a widespread issue that affects countries globally, with varying level of severity. Nigeria is one such country where gender inequality is deeply rooted and has a substantial impact on women's economic wellbeing, despite having the largest economy on the continent and impressive GDP growth. This study examined the relationship between gender inequality and socioeconomic development in Nigeria from 1991 to 2022. The data for the variables were obtained from the NBS, WDI, and the UNDP. The dependent variable used include the poverty rate (POVR), while the independent variables are the ratio of labour force participation for females to males (RLFP), the gross primary school enrolment rate for females to males (GPER), population growth (POPG), and the adolescent fertility rate (ADFR). The data analysis techniques used includes unit root tests, bounds cointegration, and the autoregressive distributed lag estimation method. The KPSS unit root tests shows an admixture of I(1) and I(0) series. Evidence of cointegration was established. The ARDL results showed that the ratio of labour force participation for females to males, the gross primary school enrolment rate for females to males, the adolescent fertility rate has a positive and statistically significant relationship with poverty. Further, the finding shows that population has a negative and statistically significant relationship on poverty rate. Based on these findings, the study recommends among others thing that government should focus on improving job quality rather than just participation. This includes promoting higher-wage, formal employment for women, enforcing equal pay laws, and expanding entrepreneurship support programs; Invest in improving access to and quality of primary education for girls. This can be achieved through scholarships, school feeding programs, and community outreach to encourage parents to send their daughters to school. Additionally, address cultural and social barriers that prevent girls from attending school. It is also recommending that government policies should focus on expanding reproductive health education, increasing contraceptive access, and providing economic incentives (such as scholarships and cash transfers) to delay early childbirth and support young mothers in continuing education.

detail.abstract: This article addresses two fundamental problems underlying contemporary nature conservation policies: (1) The biolegal philosophy behind the EU Nature Conservation legislation is outdated and still perceives nature merely as species and area protection; (2) In international law, biodiversity is presented as if it were an end in itself. These two approaches are incorrect from the perspective of theoretical biology and systems biology. What actually needs to be protected is the continuity of biogeochemical cycles and ecosystem energetics; biodiversity is a measurable indicator of the health of these processes. However, diplomats and lawyers without basic science education draft international law, which results in regulatory frameworks detached from scientific essence. This article aims to re-found the theory of nature conservation in this framework.

detail.title: Motivational Needs, Instructional Competence and Problem-Solving Skills of Teachers in Relation to Performance: Basis for Training Program

publicationDetails.detailsText: Psychology and Education: A Multidisciplinary Journal, volume 42, issue 7, 2025[10.70838/pemj.420706]

detail.abstract: This study examined the motivational needs, instructional competence, and problem-solving skills of teachers in relation to performance in Cluster IV of the Fourth Congressional District of Negros Occidental, covering the municipalities of Pulupandan, Valladolid, San Enrique, and Pontevedra for the School Year 2023-2024. The study utilized standardized questionnaires: Santillan (2002) for motivational needs and Moreno, Silveira, and Belandro (2015) for instructional competence, which were adapted and modified. A research-made instrument was developed to assess problem-solving skills. Out of 359 teachers, 189 participated in the study. Findings showed that teachers demonstrated very high levels of motivational needs and instructional competence, and high levels of problem-solving skills. Their overall performance was rated as very satisfactory. Analysis revealed no significant differences in motivational needs, instructional competence, and problem-solving skills when grouped according to profile variables such as age, gender, and civil status. However, teacher performance significantly differed when grouped by length of service and highest educational attainment. Moreover, there were no significant relationships found between the teachers' motivational needs, instructional competence, and problem-solving skills in relation to their performance. These findings suggest that while teachers demonstrate strong professional attributes, these alone do not significantly predict their overall performance, indicating the need to explore other contributing factors that influence teacher effectiveness.

AI.tldr: 本研究探讨了教师动机需求、教学能力和问题解决技能与绩效的关系，发现教师在这些方面表现优异，但个人属性（如年龄、性别）对绩效无显著影响，而服务年限和教育程度则显著影响绩效。
AI.research_question: 教师的动机需求、教学能力和问题解决技能如何影响其绩效？
AI.motivation: 了解教师专业能力与绩效的关系，以提升教育质量。
AI.theoretical_framework: 基于Santillan（2002）的动机需求理论和Moreno等（2015）的教学能力理论。
AI.method: 采用标准化问卷（动机需求和教学能力）和自研工具（问题解决技能），对189名教师进行调查。
AI.findings: 教师在动机需求和教学能力上表现非常高，问题解决技能高，绩效非常满意；服务年限和教育程度显著影响绩效。
AI.theory_contributions: 补充了教师绩效影响因素的研究，强调个人属性以外的变量。
AI.practical_contributions: 建议关注服务年限和教育程度对绩效的影响，并探索其他潜在因素。

affiliations: University of Eldoret

detail.title: Corruption, Democracy, and Economic Growth in Kenya

publicationDetails.detailsText: Asian Journal of Economics and Empirical Research, volume 12, issue 1, 2025[10.20448/ajeer.v12i1.6920]

detail.abstract: The relationship between corruption, democracy, and economic growth is complex and multifaceted across empirical studies. Understanding this relationship is crucial for policymakers, researchers, and scholars alike as they seek to promote stable democracies and sustained economic development in middle-income countries. Kenya has long grappled with issues of corruption and challenges to its democratic processes. These problems have significant implications for governance, economic growth, political stability, religion, and social cohesion. This study investigates the effects of democracy and corruption control on Kenya's economic growth from 1990 to 2020. Utilizing the generalized method of moments (GMM) model for regression econometric analysis, the findings indicate that both democracy and control of corruption exert a positive and significant influence on economic growth in Kenya. The results of the democracy model support a positive correlation between democratic governance and economic development, while the corruption model aligns with the "sand in the wheels" hypothesis, suggesting that corruption may hinder economic growth in Kenya. Consequently, advancing democracy, streamlining bureaucratic processes, and implementing anti-corruption measures are crucial for achieving sustainable economic growth in Kenya. Ultimately, promoting good governance and transparency is essential for sustainable economic development, as strong democratic institutions can help mitigate corruption and enhance economic growth potential.

AI.tldr: 本文研究了1990年至2020年间民主与腐败控制对肯尼亚经济增长的影响，发现两者均对经济增长有显著正向作用。
AI.research_question: 民主与腐败控制如何影响肯尼亚的经济增长？
AI.motivation: 肯尼亚长期面临腐败和民主进程的挑战，这些问题对治理、经济增长和社会稳定有重要影响。
AI.theoretical_framework: 研究基于广义矩估计（GMM）模型，结合民主与腐败对经济增长的理论假设。
AI.method: 采用广义矩估计（GMM）模型进行回归计量分析。
AI.findings: 民主和腐败控制对肯尼亚经济增长均有显著正向影响，腐败模型支持“沙轮效应”假设。
AI.theory_contributions: 验证了民主与腐败控制对经济增长的理论关系，支持“沙轮效应”假设。
AI.practical_contributions: 建议推动民主化、简化官僚流程和实施反腐措施，以促进肯尼亚的可持续经济增长。

detail.title: Evaluation of the Economic Impact of a Country’s Accession to the Schengen Area -The Case of Bulgaria

publicationDetails.detailsText: Economic Thought journal, volume 69, issue 2, 2024[10.56497/etj2469201]

detail.abstract: The Schengen agreement further strengthens the implementation of the principles of free movement of goods, services and persons provided in the EU and beyond. This intergovernmental agreement offers a lot of challenges that need to be examined for building understanding of the complexity of consequences of a large magnitude. The aim of this study is to develop and apply a comprehensive methodology in order to evaluate the economic effects of a country`s accession to the Schengen area. The study explores different types of economic implications, including direct, potential, ecological and fiscal effects. Moreover, the universality of the methodology provides for its comprehensive and wide applicability under different context and scenarios of abolition of border control. The developed methodology has been applied in order to evaluate the economic impact on Bulgaria from the country`s accession to the Schengen area.

AI.tldr: 本研究旨在开发并应用一种综合方法，评估一个国家加入申根区的经济影响，包括直接、潜在、生态和财政效应。该方法具有广泛适用性，并以保加利亚为例进行了实证分析。

AI.motivation: 申根协议进一步推动了欧盟内外商品、服务和人员的自由流动，但其复杂性带来了许多挑战，需要深入研究其经济后果。

AI.method: 开发并应用综合方法，分析直接、潜在、生态和财政效应。
AI.findings: 研究揭示了保加利亚加入申根区的经济影响，包括多方面的效应。
AI.theory_contributions: 提出了一种评估区域经济一体化影响的综合方法。
AI.practical_contributions: 为政策制定者提供了评估申根区加入经济影响的工具，适用于不同情境和边境控制取消的场景。
